subject: Adds flavor support for Nova V3 API
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2013-12-15 12:13:47.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/v3/test_flavors.py', 'novaclient/tests/v1_1/test_flavors.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/flavors.py', 'novaclient/v3/client.py', 'novaclient/v3/flavors.py', 'novaclient/tests/v3/fakes.py'], 'message': 'Adds flavor support for Nova V3 API

The first part of adding flavor support for the Nova V3 API (support
for flavor-access API calls is still to come).

Restructures v1_1 testcases so as much as possible so they can be
reused for the V3 version of the tests. If it looks too ugly an
alternative would be to just cut and paste the fakes and test
from v1_1 to v3, which is simpler to understand but comes at the
cost of duplicated code. The upside though is it would be much
easier to remove v1_1/v2 support in the future.

Change-Id: Ic7cb3c43db02c07d37aea2675b310aaa50639c40
'}]
commit_message:
Adds flavor support for Nova V3 API

The first part of adding flavor support for the Nova V3 API (support
for flavor-access API calls is still to come).

Restructures v1_1 testcases so as much as possible so they can be
reused for the V3 version of the tests. If it looks too ugly an
alternative would be to just cut and paste the fakes and test
from v1_1 to v3, which is simpler to understand but comes at the
cost of duplicated code. The upside though is it would be much
easier to remove v1_1/v2 support in the future.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api

Change-Id: Ic7cb3c43db02c07d37aea2675b310aaa50639c40

commit_message:
WaitCondition Count property is now updatable

The Count property of WaitCondition resource was modified to be
updatable.
Now, when that property is updated, the WaitCondition and the associated
WaitConditionHandle are no longer being regenerated.

Change-Id: If234b7a1400ff1b2c17fc24c436d8f64f4b1fd88
Closes-Bug: #1228362

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 6172, 'name': 'Boris Pavlovic', 'email': 'boris@pavlovic.me', 'username': 'boris-42'}, {'_account_id': 6722, 'name': 'ChangBo Guo(gcb)', 'email': 'guochbo@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'guochbo'}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7491, 'name': 'Viktor Serhieiev', 'email': 'viktor.sergeyev@gmail.com', 'username': 'vsergeyev'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-11-14 13:03:34.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/db/api.py', 'tests/unit/db/test_api.py'], 'message': 'Remove lazy loading of database backend

A single DBAPI instance is created globally in target projects at module
import time. As those projects are mostly API services (i.e. DB
oriented), there is no much sense in lazy loading of a DB backend. On
the other hand, if we initialize the DB backend as soon as a DBAPI
instance is created, we simplify code a lot, get rid of the lock and
remove the overhead of checking if the backend has been initialized from
every __getattr__() call.

Change-Id: I9fdf3eab32ee0f078d64fbde35df81c2d1123ae2
'}]
commit_message:
Remove lazy loading of database backend

A single DBAPI instance is created globally in target projects at module
import time. As those projects are mostly API services (i.e. DB
oriented), there is no much sense in lazy loading of a DB backend. On
the other hand, if we initialize the DB backend as soon as a DBAPI
instance is created, we simplify code a lot, get rid of the lock and
remove the overhead of checking if the backend has been initialized from
every __getattr__() call.

Change-Id: I9fdf3eab32ee0f078d64fbde35df81c2d1123ae2

Cinder uses tgt to expose volumes via iscsi. Without tgt cinder will

iscsitarget, which is a competing iscsi management solution to tgt.

Closes-Bug: #1261504

'}]
commit_message:
Need tgt for cinder

Cinder uses tgt to expose volumes via iscsi. Without tgt cinder will
fail to schedule/setup all volumes. Cinder does not actually utilize
iscsitarget, which is a competing iscsi management solution to tgt.

Closes-Bug: #1261504
Change-Id: I29595b206c4e85d68fbfa82db3d32a0b8b9dd89e

commit_message:
V2: disallow image format update for active status

The V2 API doesn't not allow empty `container_format` and `disk_format`
when creating a new image.
Currently, it is possible to update these properties after data have
been saved to the image which is contradictory with the previous
statement.
This change disallows modifications of these properties for images with
a status different than `queued`.

Change-Id: I98c22197ba6d96470976718d48ac53748a19ffc6
Closes-Bug: #1249412

subject: Fix display of images in Rebuild Instance
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-06 00:36:49.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/test/test_data/glance_data.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/forms.py'], 'message': 'Fix display of images in Rebuild Instance

The image list in Rebuild Instance is constructed from (id, name)
pairs. As the name is a string, the transform function is never called
unless image name is None. In that case it crashes the view.

This change:
  - Builds the image list with (id, image) so the correct thing
      is passed to the transform
  - Corrects the size/name attributes
  - Handles None display name (displays id instead)
  - Set the name of one of the public images in glance_data.py to
      None so errors like these are picked up in the future.

Change-Id: I0d1f8594cccc404c0dd6f254b70d23789817dd06
Closes-bug: #1258349
'}]
commit_message:
Fix display of images in Rebuild Instance

The image list in Rebuild Instance is constructed from (id, name)
pairs. As the name is a string, the transform function is never called
unless image name is None. In that case it crashes the view.

This change:
  - Builds the image list with (id, image) so the correct thing
      is passed to the transform
  - Corrects the size/name attributes
  - Handles None display name (displays id instead)
  - Set the name of one of the public images in glance_data.py to
      None so errors like these are picked up in the future.

Change-Id: I0d1f8594cccc404c0dd6f254b70d23789817dd06
Closes-bug: #1258349

commit_message:
Cleanly fail when location URI is malformed

At the moment when a malformed URI is passed at either image creation
or update Glance fails with an Error 500. This commit allows Glance
to fails cleanly with a 400 BadStoreUri.

Change-Id: Iffe9be3b65758d18c7e7f96b3ceb3399b9748b63
Closes-bug: #1257498

commit_message:
Django Formset support in DataTable

Add FormsetDataTable and FormsetDataTableMixin classes that allow you
to use a Django Formset with your DataTable, making it possible to edit
the data displayed.

Implements: blueprint formset-data-table

Change-Id: I636fa3ae9847f1700eae0fb5293fa97683ba2218

    In Firefox $('body').scrollTop returns 0, that's why the modal

commit_message:
Change how scrollShift is calculated.

    In Firefox $('body').scrollTop returns 0, that's why the modal
    appear outside the visible screen. Added $('hmtl).scrollTop.

    var scrollShift = $('body').scrollTop() || $('html').scrollTop()

    Closes-Bug: 1251361

Change-Id: Icf691eb140e091615a98f1fbd415428cd418ba9e

commit_message:
Added Tenant-Create step to Create Base Networks

As reported to Launchpad, the creation of the base networks
document expects the user to create one or more initial tenants.
Whilst this has been done in prior steps, it's not clear, or
obvious how to do it. I've added a basic one-liner and linked
to relevant supporting documents in the install-guide.

Changes also fix a minor typo and append the "--tenant-id"
parameter to the user input sections where required.

Change-Id: I8ef3d3c69a5b10a9a4906f4249da1605f9a01e4c
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: 1261165
(cherry picked from commit 5a184ab933e76100ba18b25d7fd7ed6d9767319e)

commit_message:
Added Neutron configuration for Nova in dedicated compute install

The installation instructions for provisioning a dedicated compute
node alongside OpenStack Networking was incomplete. It did not cover
how to configure Nova itself to communicate and make use of Neutron
networking.

Change-Id: I6e4772f5460ff84109db21c28e4edd2ff7e45d7f
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: 1260566

commit_message:
Missing LVM package install step on Ubuntu

The Cinder Block Storage service node guide was missing a
step to install the lvm2 packages. These packages needed
to be installed before the pvcreate and vgcreate steps
were initiated.

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-12-16 14:44:33.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/trust/controllers.py', 'keystone/tests/test_v3_auth.py'], 'message': 'trustee unable to perform role based operations on trust

There was a typo in a conditional that checked the trustor twice, instead
of trustee and trustor. The typo was preventing a trustee from being
able to list or get or check roles that were delegated.

Also, removed the spurious check of is_admin from said conditional
(_is_trustor_trustee_admin), and renamed it to _is_trustor_trustee.

An additional check, to see if a trust existed, was removed since it
was repeated unnecessarily.

Added a test to cover the gap that was discovered in the bug report.

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Id61e71cb3ea7c6bc51783af067fbbbe4c9bffafe
Closes-Bug: 1261104
'}]
commit_message:
trustee unable to perform role based operations on trust

There was a typo in a conditional that checked the trustor twice, instead
of trustee and trustor. The typo was preventing a trustee from being
able to list or get or check roles that were delegated.

Also, removed the spurious check of is_admin from said conditional
(_is_trustor_trustee_admin), and renamed it to _is_trustor_trustee.

An additional check, to see if a trust existed, was removed since it
was repeated unnecessarily.

Added a test to cover the gap that was discovered in the bug report.

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Id61e71cb3ea7c6bc51783af067fbbbe4c9bffafe
Closes-Bug: 1261104

commit_message:
Add a get_resources() method to the pollsters

This is a first step towards improving the central agent so that we can run
multiple ones at once while keeping the same behaviour.

This is a first step towards implementing the
task-distribution-for-central-agents blueprint. Then, we'll need to add an 'id'
parameter to the pollsters' get_samples() methods, which will allow us to
distribute polling tasks to a central agent.

Blueprint: task-distribution-for-central-agents
Change-Id: Ia9d3d3c4f667671d55ac31ad38a180a069b65140

commit_message:
Bug: horizon is removing the URL path from glance's endpoint

Autor: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Glanceclient removes the API version from the endpoint in case it exists. Look the following code:

https://github.com/openstack/python-glanceclient/blob/master/glanceclient/shell.py#L310

The rest of code includes the API version in use accordingly.

Closes-Bug: #1188182

Change-Id: I0e73d7d9241dec9be07bfd6fd643642bad486aa8

subject: Makes find_resource aware if param is id or name
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-11-26 12:03:32.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/utils.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/test_utils.py'], 'message': "Makes find_resource aware if param is id or name

find_resource tries to get object by their id, and only when it fails
it will do a search by name. This produces an unecessary warning on
the server side: 'Could not find user/role'. This fix adds an is_uuid
method in keystoneclient.utils and makes according request whenever

Closes-Bug: #1252291
"}]
commit_message:
Makes find_resource aware if param is id or name

find_resource tries to get object by their id, and only when it fails
it will do a search by name. This produces an unecessary warning on
the server side: 'Could not find user/role'. This fix adds an is_uuid
method in keystoneclient.utils and makes according request whenever
param is an id or a name.

Change-Id: I84c3c8f3b6d1899b538809335863e887fe41837b
Closes-Bug: #1252291

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-11-26 09:04:47.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/compute/api.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': 'Make rebuild use new-style BDMs

Rebuild call needs to be using new style BDMs as since the change
I5b9c3e2d959c602fa22f49db681da918ae0adcea the _prep_block_device method
of the compute manager class can accept only new style BDMs.

This patch removes the DB call for BDMs from the API side and RPCs None
instead (a valid value all version know how to handle), so that we can
make sure that the new style BDMs are retrieved from the conductor on
the compute side, without having to bump the RPC versions. The compute
node will do this regardless of whether the client side actually sent
them, so that upgraded nodes do not regress.

Closes-bug: 1241615
blueprint: clean-up-legacy-block-device-mapping

Change-Id: Ibe49ec2ec5151191f3887bb9c7b9d296e79fad5e
'}]
commit_message:
Make rebuild use new-style BDMs

Rebuild call needs to be using new style BDMs as since the change
I5b9c3e2d959c602fa22f49db681da918ae0adcea the _prep_block_device method
of the compute manager class can accept only new style BDMs.

This patch removes the DB call for BDMs from the API side and RPCs None
instead (a valid value all version know how to handle), so that we can
make sure that the new style BDMs are retrieved from the conductor on
the compute side, without having to bump the RPC versions. The compute
node will do this regardless of whether the client side actually sent
them, so that upgraded nodes do not regress.

Closes-bug: 1241615
blueprint: clean-up-legacy-block-device-mapping

Change-Id: Ibe49ec2ec5151191f3887bb9c7b9d296e79fad5e

commit_message:
Make rebuild use new-style BDMs

Rebuild call needs to be using new style BDMs as since the change
I5b9c3e2d959c602fa22f49db681da918ae0adcea the _prep_block_device method
of the compute manager class can accept only new style BDMs.

This patch removes the DB call for BDMs from the API side and RPCs None
instead (a valid value all version know how to handle), so that we can
make sure that the new style BDMs are retrieved from the conductor on
the compute side, without having to bump the RPC versions. The compute
node will do this regardless of whether the client side actually sent
them, so that upgraded nodes do not regress.

Closes-bug: 1241615
blueprint: clean-up-legacy-block-device-mapping

Change-Id: Ibe49ec2ec5151191f3887bb9c7b9d296e79fad5e
(cherry picked from commit aafee652f808f68ef38d8950a05242d578f5e8a5)

subject: LVM: report thin pool capacity in a reasonable way
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2243, 'name': 'John Griffith', 'email': 'john.griffith8@gmail.com', 'username': 'john-griffith'}, {'_account_id': 4355, 'name': 'Avishay Traeger', 'email': 'avishay@stratoscale.com', 'username': 'avishay-il'}, {'_account_id': 4523, 'name': 'Eric Harney', 'email': 'eharney@redhat.com', 'username': 'eharney'}, {'_account_id': 7198, 'name': 'Jay Bryant', 'email': 'jungleboyj@electronicjungle.net', 'username': 'jsbryant'}, {'_account_id': 8574, 'name': 'Qin Zhao', 'username': 'zhaoqin', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 9236, 'name': 'Jon Bernard', 'email': 'jobernar@redhat.com', 'username': 'jbernard'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2013-12-05 20:20:48.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_volume.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/lvm.py'], 'message': "LVM: report thin pool capacity in a reasonable way

Now that thin pools are created of adequate size, capacity reporting
must be updated so that users can successfully create new volumes.  The
existing code reports the size and remaining capacity of the volume
group.  When 'thin' is enabled, the thin pool takes up nearly all of the
volume group and available capacity appears to be 0 - preventing any new
volumes from being created.

This patch changes thin LVM capacity reporting to always report
available capacity as the total size of the thin pool.  For users, this
means a couple of things:

  1. No single volume can exceed the size of the thin pool.
  2. An infinite number of volumes can be created, all backed by the
     same thin pool.

This allows infinite over-provisioning of thin LVM.  It is left to the
user to monitor the actual free space remaining in the pool and make use
of thin volumes accordingly.

Additional improvements are being considered, so expect updates to this
logic in the near future.

Change-Id: I8a2b8ce972cb0a585555dd92c78dd8bbade1a9b2
Closes-Bug: #1249782
"}]
commit_message:
LVM: report thin pool capacity in a reasonable way

Now that thin pools are created of adequate size, capacity reporting
must be updated so that users can successfully create new volumes.  The
existing code reports the size and remaining capacity of the volume
group.  When 'thin' is enabled, the thin pool takes up nearly all of the
volume group and available capacity appears to be 0 - preventing any new
volumes from being created.

This patch changes thin LVM capacity reporting to always report
available capacity as the total size of the thin pool.  For users, this
means a couple of things:

  1. No single volume can exceed the size of the thin pool.
  2. An infinite number of volumes can be created, all backed by the
     same thin pool.

This allows infinite over-provisioning of thin LVM.  It is left to the
user to monitor the actual free space remaining in the pool and make use
of thin volumes accordingly.

Additional improvements are being considered, so expect updates to this
logic in the near future.

Change-Id: I8a2b8ce972cb0a585555dd92c78dd8bbade1a9b2
Closes-Bug: #1249782

commit_message:
Added versioned endpoint description

Nothing in this commit is proposing anything new, but rather describing
the existing behavior of the unversioned endpoint and the
behavior/structure of v3's versioned endpoint response.

Also added explicit `/v3/` on documented resources in the API to more
clearly differentiate from `/` and `/v3/` throughout the document.

Change-Id: Ibf6342f035578a3c2dfebdc440ef6512221057b7

commit_message:
Nexenta backup service

This patch adds 'nexenta' backup driver to support any type of cinder
volume backup/restore to/from NexentaStor backend. The driver should
support all types of volumes to be backed up to and restored from
NexentaStor backend. This will be done naively as we don't know any
specifics about volume to be backed up.

Implements: blueprint volume-backup-nexenta-backend
Change-Id: I33516672c0929e2f3babdd3184ea747455e89472

commit_message:
Allows using interger values for project enabled

The code was already converting the integer to the correct boolean
value. The problem was that it did this in a copy of the project
reference dictionary, but used the original when making the
create/update calls. The data would be successfully stored, but a
traceback would be raised when fetching from the data store.

Closes-Bug #1199652
Change-Id: I777e7c6577a5c0773458758ed457e9a19d20c9f4

subject: Prevent spoofing instance_id from neutron to nova
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-11 20:38:30.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/metadata/handler.py', 'nova/tests/test_metadata.py'], 'message': "Prevent spoofing instance_id from neutron to nova

Previously, one could update a port's device_id in neutron to be
that of another tenant's instance_id and then be able to retrieve
that instance's metadata. This patch prevents this from occurring by
checking that X-Tenant-ID received from the metadata request matches
the tenant_id in the nova database.

DocImpact - This patch is dependent on another patch in neutron
            which adds X-Tenant-ID to the request. Therefore to
            minimize downtime one should upgrade Neutron first (then
            restart neutron-metadata-agent) and lastly update nova.

Change-Id: I93bf662797c3986324ca2099b403833c2e990fb4
Closes-Bug: #1235450
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent spoofing instance_id from neutron to nova

Previously, one could update a port's device_id in neutron to be
that of another tenant's instance_id and then be able to retrieve
that instance's metadata. This patch prevents this from occurring by
checking that X-Tenant-ID received from the metadata request matches
the tenant_id in the nova database.

DocImpact - This patch is dependent on another patch in neutron
            which adds X-Tenant-ID to the request. Therefore to
            minimize downtime one should upgrade Neutron first (then
            restart neutron-metadata-agent) and lastly update nova.

Change-Id: I93bf662797c3986324ca2099b403833c2e990fb4
Closes-Bug: #1235450

commit_message:
Revert "glance-manage should work like nova-manage"

This change has a bug that does not seem to take version option into
consideration. A fix for the same bug has been submitted for review at
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/60188/1. However while adding unit
tests to glance-manage oslo.cfg reset doesnt seem to work properly and
all the subsequent tests seem to fail. Untill the tests are fixed
reverting this change to avoid broken functionality.

This reverts commit 7e6319d95554413f1a0856603f434c9c60b8d256

Change-Id: I1d821ef75b4a77499579f18a6f211aac136132f5

On an forbidden update, the message returned to the user
is not tied to the type of object modified by the operation.

commit_message:
Forbidden update message diffs images/tasks/member

On an forbidden update, the message returned to the user
is not tied to the type of object modified by the operation.
For example: a forbidden image member update will return
`You are not permitted to modify 'status' on this image.`
instead of image_member.

This patch fixes the issue for images, image members and tasks.

Change-Id: Ie9774807f0190a517a619aeb56c1398741ac4407
Closes-Bug: #1250228

commit_message:
Rename instance_type to flavor in nova.network tree

Renames 'instance_type' to 'flavor' in the nova.network tree along with
related tests.

Note that 'instance_type_id' is part of the Instance table in the data
model and is not touched as part of this change.

Part of blueprint flavor-instance-type-dedup

commit_message:
Add missing argument max_size in libvirt driver

max_size argument was added in commit 3cdfe894ab58f7b91bf7fb690fc5bc724e44066f,
but missing  in _create_ephemeral and _create_swap method, which cause
exception raised when caching ephemeral and swap disk files of the instance.

Add test for _create_ephemeral used with max_size parameter
and test _create_swap method

Closes-Bug: 1251152
Closes-Bug: 1250032
(cherry picked from commit 384f55bcb32251698cc2ce839a0286ef99e74984)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/test_libvirt.py
	nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

Change-Id: I46032ad32f317c923692b8b3d40cedd0dce06cad

commit_message:
Add flavor access methods to Instance object

This adds a native interface to the Instance object to get, save, and
delete either the main or stashed flavors. This will let us migrate
code away from flavors.py and also provide us a versioned method to
handle conversion of flavors, flavor extra specs, and system_metadata
to the JSON blob that we have planned.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects

Change-Id: I13a4903460b05798e9c95b2148fe93e4963d6361

subject: 3PAR FC: add ability to add WWNs to host
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-12-16 19:10:33.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_fc.py', 'cinder/tests/test_hp3par.py'], 'message': '3PAR FC: add ability to add WWNs to host

When a host is created on the HP 3PAR array,
at initialize connection time, the host is
created with all WWNs provided in the connector
structure. However, the driver did not have
the ability to add new WWNs after a host is created.

This patch adds the ability to add WWNs to a
host, at initialize connection time, if a new
WWN is provided in the connector structure.

Change-Id: I6fd8a5511f83d5460da30ff5558a3e95964a95f5
Closes-bug: 1258229

commit_message:
3PAR FC: add ability to add WWNs to host

When a host is created on the HP 3PAR array,
at initialize connection time, the host is
created with all WWNs provided in the connector
structure. However, the driver did not have
the ability to add new WWNs after a host is created.

This patch adds the ability to add WWNs to a
host, at initialize connection time, if a new
WWN is provided in the connector structure.

Change-Id: I6fd8a5511f83d5460da30ff5558a3e95964a95f5
Closes-bug: 1258229

Several warnings and errors are reported when the Keystone
documentation is built because the docstrings are not valid
reStructuredText. This makes it more difficult than necessary
for developers to validate that new changes are correct.

This change corrects the docstrings so that there are fewer
warnings and errors.

Change-Id: I2000a02d5d374749b2c611e63743d542b74e7fa0
'}]
commit_message:
Correct invalid docstrings

Several warnings and errors are reported when the Keystone
documentation is built because the docstrings are not valid
reStructuredText. This makes it more difficult than necessary
for developers to validate that new changes are correct.

This change corrects the docstrings so that there are fewer
warnings and errors.

Change-Id: I2000a02d5d374749b2c611e63743d542b74e7fa0

commit_message:
Include lswitch id in NSX plugin port mappings

This patch adds the logical switch identifier in the model class
for describing mappings between neutron and nsx switch ports.
This will allow for a better handling of the chained logical switch
use case.

This patch also moves the routines for retrieving nsx identifiers
in a separate module in preparation for the introduction of async
operations and renames relevant model classes, attributes, and
functions from 'nvp' to 'nsx'.

Related to blueprint nvp-async-backend-communication
Related to blueprint nicira-plugin-renaming

Change-Id: I5fa1e8f0d863b7d1fc278ffdeac8acc076a843e8

subject: NVP plugin: Avoid timeouts if creating routers in parallel
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 261, 'name': 'Salvatore Orlando', 'email': 'salv.orlando@gmail.com', 'username': 'salvatore-orlando'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}, {'_account_id': 6659, 'name': 'Paul Michali', 'email': 'pc@michali.net', 'username': 'pcm'}, {'_account_id': 7317, 'name': 'Bo Lin', 'email': 'linb@vmware.com', 'username': 'berlin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-13 11:26:15.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/nicira/NeutronPlugin.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/nicira/test_nicira_plugin.py'], 'message': 'NVP plugin: Avoid timeouts if creating routers in parallel

There is a well-known issue of eventlet causing deadlocks with
mysql transactions; such condition might occur when
creating NVP routers in parallel.

To avoid this, this patch moves the long-running method
_update_router_gw_info outside of the mysql transaction, adding
the appropriate failure management code, and adds a lock to the
method _nvp_create_ext_gw_port, to ensure serial access to it.

Unit tests for verifying correct behaviour in case of failures
are added as well.

Closes Bug: #1251847

Change-Id: I2864e2f5bfd3982875ef9df97186f64a9fcaa0e0
'}]
commit_message:
NVP plugin: Avoid timeouts if creating routers in parallel

There is a well-known issue of eventlet causing deadlocks with
mysql transactions; such condition might occur when
creating NVP routers in parallel.

To avoid this, this patch moves the long-running method
_update_router_gw_info outside of the mysql transaction, adding
the appropriate failure management code, and adds a lock to the
method _nvp_create_ext_gw_port, to ensure serial access to it.

Unit tests for verifying correct behaviour in case of failures
are added as well.

Closes Bug: #1251847

Change-Id: I2864e2f5bfd3982875ef9df97186f64a9fcaa0e0

subject: db: fix duplicate entry detection
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-15 10:34:43.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/session.py'], 'message': 'db: fix duplicate entry detection

On some versions of SQLite, the exception reporting the IntegrityError
has a different message than the one actually looked for.
This patch adds this version and the ability to look for different
regexps at the same time to match exceptions.

Change-Id: I1faa94ac6b1ac20482e8bb314bd8430b2d69e2eb
'}]
commit_message:
db: fix duplicate entry detection

On some versions of SQLite, the exception reporting the IntegrityError
has a different message than the one actually looked for.
This patch adds this version and the ability to look for different
regexps at the same time to match exceptions.

Change-Id: I1faa94ac6b1ac20482e8bb314bd8430b2d69e2eb

subject: Updates tox.ini to use new features
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-09 15:30:53.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Updates tox.ini to use new features

Reasons:
 - tox update v1.6

Changes:
 - tox 1.6 allows us to skip the sdist step, which is slow.
 - It also allows us to override the install line. In this case, it's
   important as it allows us to stop getting pre-release software we
   weren't asking for.

Original patch by Monty Taylor, talked about here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/015495.html

Change-Id: I8a8fdd420eceb5b702e7d9eedd8b5be341d3f56e
"}]
commit_message:
Updates tox.ini to use new features

Reasons:
 - tox update v1.6

Changes:
 - tox 1.6 allows us to skip the sdist step, which is slow.
 - It also allows us to override the install line. In this case, it's
   important as it allows us to stop getting pre-release software we
   weren't asking for.

Original patch by Monty Taylor, talked about here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/015495.html

Change-Id: I8a8fdd420eceb5b702e7d9eedd8b5be341d3f56e

commit_message:
[Netapp/Nexenta] Move registration of config options

This doesn't really make a difference in practice, but
makes it possible for the sample config generator to figure
out the config group relationship when options are in one
file.

Change-Id: I3bc6ab5bcc85a8c11c9261b0d8c520fb846a7864

commit_message:
Replace uuidutils.generate_uuid() with str(uuid.uuid4())

Oslo is deprecating/removing uuidutils during the icehouse cycle.
Consequently we need to remove all references to uuidutils, and
replace them with the corresponding function from neutron.

Change-Id: If7d377b28fcd9f557f5d42afba241ae48a19e36b
Partial-Bug: #1253497

subject: Correct OS-TRUST extension expires_at responses
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-05 18:14:40.000000000', 'files': ['openstack-identity-api/v3/src/markdown/identity-api-v3-os-trust-ext.md'], 'message': 'Correct OS-TRUST extension expires_at responses

All of the GET responses contain expires_at, which from speaking
to the original author I understand is an ommission to the docs
due to the code getting subsequently updated.

So to align the docs with the real API responses, add an expires_at
to each of the example responses.

Change-Id: Ifdfb9df04c730cf2f79a5e79daccf9a24342556d
'}]
commit_message:
Correct OS-TRUST extension expires_at responses

All of the GET responses contain expires_at, which from speaking
to the original author I understand is an ommission to the docs
due to the code getting subsequently updated.

So to align the docs with the real API responses, add an expires_at
to each of the example responses.

Change-Id: Ifdfb9df04c730cf2f79a5e79daccf9a24342556d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-16 21:26:33.000000000', 'files': ['functions', 'files/apts/glance', 'stackrc', 'files/rpms/glance'], 'message': 'Adds new tag for testonly packages in package lists

Also introduces a new parameter INSTALL_TESTONLY_PACKAGES
in the stackrc with False as default value. Setting it to
True stack.sh will install all packages tagged with the tag
testonly in the package lists.

Includes needed packages for Ubuntu and Fedora

(cherry-picked from commit 71d5630)
Closes-Bug: #1203680
Change-Id: I911a6601819a34262853bba0658f6751148bfbec
'}]
commit_message:
Adds new tag for testonly packages in package lists

Also introduces a new parameter INSTALL_TESTONLY_PACKAGES
in the stackrc with False as default value. Setting it to
True stack.sh will install all packages tagged with the tag
testonly in the package lists.

Includes needed packages for Ubuntu and Fedora

(cherry-picked from commit 71d5630)
Closes-Bug: #1203680
Change-Id: I911a6601819a34262853bba0658f6751148bfbec

commit_message:
Add support for authenticating with saml (Federation pt3)

To complete federation, we should be able to handle authentication
requests that come in saml. Heavily influenced by prior work done
by Kristy and David.

Co-Authored-By: Kristy Siu <kwss@kent.ac.uk>
Co-Authored-By: David Chadwick <d.w.chadwick@kent.ac.uk>
Co-Authored-By: Joe Savak <jsavak@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Marek Denis <marek.denis@cern.ch>
Implements: blueprint auth-saml

Change-Id: I62cd00aea6c389a875d66d5528b265252e3af735

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-10-24 00:36:27.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': "Add lockmode in IPAllocation query in delete_subnet in ML2

We faced several issues regarding to IPAllocation table lock.
We have fixed these issues using lockmode. All of IPAllocation query
in db plugin has lockmode. However ML2 delete_subnt isn't using.
This may cause a dead locking issue, so we are adding it
in this commit.

Partially fixes bug: 1243726

Change-Id: I7f11483556feb282a150557dd7c28eacc9a0373d
"}]
commit_message:
Add lockmode in IPAllocation query in delete_subnet in ML2

We faced several issues regarding to IPAllocation table lock.
We have fixed these issues using lockmode. All of IPAllocation query
in db plugin has lockmode. However ML2 delete_subnt isn't using.
This may cause a dead locking issue, so we are adding it
in this commit.

Partially fixes bug: 1243726

Change-Id: I7f11483556feb282a150557dd7c28eacc9a0373d

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-11-25 10:22:08.000000000', 'files': ['openstack-identity-api/v3/src/markdown/identity-api-v3-os-trust-ext.md'], 'message': 'Limited use trusts

Trusts now have a "remaining_uses" field that track how many times
a trust can still issue a token. It is decremented each time a
trust related authentication occurs. If set to null, trusts can be
used indefinitely to authenticate.

Fix for bug #1250617

Change-Id: I739cd583eea2363724b888e9c2b9b9158a9838c1
'}]
commit_message:
Limited use trusts

Trusts now have a "remaining_uses" field that track how many times
a trust can still issue a token. It is decremented each time a
trust related authentication occurs. If set to null, trusts can be
used indefinitely to authenticate.

Fix for bug #1250617

Change-Id: I739cd583eea2363724b888e9c2b9b9158a9838c1

commit_message:
Enable tasks REST API for async worker

- add REST API layer for async worker(tasks) to
support tasks operations.
- update to include sparse task for tasks.index
- add domain proxies for handling  authorization,
policy enforce, notification while processing
task requests.
- add Task domain entity and TaskFactory to create
new Task domain entity objects.
- add integration test for testing tasks api

Co-authored-by: Fei Long Wang <flwang@cn.ibm.com>

Partially implement blueprint async-glance-workers

Change-Id: I072cbf351c06f59a7702733b652bfa63e5abbaa6

commit_message:
Support oslo-rootwrap in lib/cinder

Make lib/cinder support both cinder-rootwrap (current case) and
oslo-rootwrap (future case) to handle the Cinder transition towards
oslo-rootwrap usage peacefully.

Related blueprint:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/cinder-oslo-rootwrap

Change-Id: I663986304bd74cb6d72d51c553540fb5f9db1d1d

commit_message:
Fix cinder migration script logic error

Script condition was logically opposite, as we only need to run losetup
-f if we could not find an existing loopback for the file.

Change-Id: Ib57c07ac26fa4c0bba66dda9ca5a95cb208a2b96

subject: Setup destination disk from virt_disk_size
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-05 16:33:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'message': 'Setup destination disk from virt_disk_size

When running live-migration --block-migrate on a qcow2 backed
VM without cow image, the destination qcow2 file should be created
with the virtual disk size. For raw images, the virt_disk_size
is set to disk_size to ensure that virt_disk_size is always the
size of the disk that should be re-created.

Update unit tests to be more strict and check for sizes to be correct.

Closes-Bug: #1257355

Change-Id: Ie3be46024f06b9f59af92f5e3918a1958386d4f1
'}]
commit_message:
Setup destination disk from virt_disk_size

When running live-migration --block-migrate on a qcow2 backed
VM without cow image, the destination qcow2 file should be created
with the virtual disk size. For raw images, the virt_disk_size
is set to disk_size to ensure that virt_disk_size is always the
size of the disk that should be re-created.

Update unit tests to be more strict and check for sizes to be correct.

Closes-Bug: #1257355

Change-Id: Ie3be46024f06b9f59af92f5e3918a1958386d4f1

commit_message:
Add tests for keystone OS-TRUST v3 API

Add tests providing coverage of the keystone v3 OS-TRUSTS extension,
as documented at:
https://github.com/openstack/identity-api/blob/master/\
openstack-identity-api/v3/src/markdown/identity-api-v3-os-trust-ext.md

This covers all the documented interfaces to create/delete/list/get
trusts and roles delegated by trusts, except those impacted by bug
1246383 and 1245590, which will be submitted separately.

A subsequent patch will add coverage for consuming trusts via the tokens API.

Note only the JSON API is currently tested due to bug #1246941

Partially-Implements: blueprint keystone-trust-api
Change-Id: I310951f070107f3af33b52fcd2c8e54d82654088

commit_message:
Avoid TypeError in is_older_than, is_newer_than

datetime doesn't like to subtract offset-naive and
offset-aware datetimes. To fix this we convert all
datetimes that are passed in to offset-naive objects.

Change-Id: Ib01568c9d287e319750b6bef3656fdcfc992a1b1
Closes-Bug: #1259383

This patch fixes the parameter documentation in
generic_service, network, objectstore, params,
qpid and quota to conform with the style guide and
support autogenerating parameter documentation.

List_volumes and list_volumes_with_detail for nova volume extension
List_volumes and list_volumes_with_detail for Cinder API

subject: vmwareapi: raise on get_console_output
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1501, 'name': 'Phil Day', 'email': 'philip.day@hp.com', 'username': 'philip-day'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 3185, 'name': 'Alessandro Pilotti', 'email': 'apilotti@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'alexpilotti'}, {'_account_id': 4190, 'name': 'lifeless', 'email': 'robertc@robertcollins.net', 'username': 'lifeless'}, {'_account_id': 5292, 'name': 'Christopher Yeoh', 'email': 'cbkyeoh@gmail.com', 'username': 'cyeoh-0'}, {'_account_id': 5754, 'name': 'Alex Xu', 'email': 'hejie.xu@intel.com', 'username': 'xuhj'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2013-12-16 15:23:58.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmwareapi.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py'], 'message': "vmwareapi: raise on get_console_output

Commit 2ce3461595a490c9a02272ee4a1ab1eb55c27f60 updated
get_console_output() in the vmwareapi driver to return a static string.
Since this isn't supported, I think the most correct thing to do here is
to raise NotImplementedError.  That will get properly propogated back
through the API.

The original change was concerned with getting a friendly message to the
user.  That should be done by the consumer of the API.  For example, if
Horizon got that as an error back, it could present a special message to
the user indicating that the operation is not supported for that
instance.

Change-Id: Ia17330b9084bf3e82219a0c143485174c3e8f6db
"}]
commit_message:
vmwareapi: raise on get_console_output

Commit 2ce3461595a490c9a02272ee4a1ab1eb55c27f60 updated
get_console_output() in the vmwareapi driver to return a static string.
Since this isn't supported, I think the most correct thing to do here is
to raise NotImplementedError.  That will get properly propogated back
through the API.

The original change was concerned with getting a friendly message to the
user.  That should be done by the consumer of the API.  For example, if
Horizon got that as an error back, it could present a special message to
the user indicating that the operation is not supported for that
instance.

Change-Id: Ia17330b9084bf3e82219a0c143485174c3e8f6db

subject: hyperv: remove get_console_output method
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1501, 'name': 'Phil Day', 'email': 'philip.day@hp.com', 'username': 'philip-day'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 3185, 'name': 'Alessandro Pilotti', 'email': 'apilotti@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'alexpilotti'}, {'_account_id': 5292, 'name': 'Christopher Yeoh', 'email': 'cbkyeoh@gmail.com', 'username': 'cyeoh-0'}, {'_account_id': 5754, 'name': 'Alex Xu', 'email': 'hejie.xu@intel.com', 'username': 'xuhj'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2013-12-16 15:23:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/hyperv/driver.py'], 'message': 'hyperv: remove get_console_output method

The get_console_method() in the hyperv driver only logged a debug
message and returned an empty string.  It seems like much better and
expected behavior to not implement the method at all so that a
NotImplementedError is raised.  This will properly propagate back
through the API.  Not Implemented is certainly different to the user
than telling them their console output is always empty.

Change-Id: I9df81a74ac533a73f30305f3eb12a8ff7608b293
'}]
commit_message:
hyperv: remove get_console_output method

The get_console_method() in the hyperv driver only logged a debug
message and returned an empty string.  It seems like much better and
expected behavior to not implement the method at all so that a
NotImplementedError is raised.  This will properly propagate back
through the API.  Not Implemented is certainly different to the user
than telling them their console output is always empty.

Change-Id: I9df81a74ac533a73f30305f3eb12a8ff7608b293

commit_message:
List NotImplementedError as client exception

Mark NotImplementedError as a client exception for the
get_console_output rpc api method.  This is an expected result if the
driver does not implement this functionality.  If raised, the rpc layer
should not log a traceback.

Change-Id: I60747bf48c378053eb0d36337fcc26201b4840f9

commit_message:
api: handle NotImplementedError for console output

Some drivers do not implement getting console output.  Catch this
exception at the API layer and return a 501 from the API in this case.

Change-Id: I144850f4431a7588430da298ba348039bed25403

subject: Fix race in unit tests, which can cause gate job to fail
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 642, 'name': 'Matt Dietz', 'email': 'matthew.dietz@gmail.com', 'username': 'cerberus'}, {'_account_id': 706, 'name': 'Brian Lamar', 'email': 'brian.lamar@rackspace.com', 'username': 'blamar'}, {'_account_id': 1501, 'name': 'Phil Day', 'email': 'philip.day@hp.com', 'username': 'philip-day'}, {'_account_id': 2934, 'name': 'Bhuvan Arumugam', 'email': 'bhuvan@apache.org', 'username': 'bhuvan'}, {'_account_id': 5511, 'name': 'Nikola Dipanov', 'email': 'ndipanov@redhat.com', 'username': 'ndipanov'}, {'_account_id': 6896, 'name': 'Loganathan Parthipan', 'email': 'parthi@hpe.com', 'username': 'parthipan'}, {'_account_id': 6969, 'name': 'Michael Kerrin', 'email': 'michael.kerrin@hpe.com', 'username': 'mkerrin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-16 16:46:19.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_fakelibvirt.py'], 'message': "Fix race in unit tests, which can cause gate job to fail

The FakeLibvirtTests.test_openAuth_can_refuse_None_uri test changes the value
of the global variable allow_default_uri_connection. We need to clean up this
change up after running this test so as we don't effect other tests that
expect the value of this variable to be the default.

In particular this test was running before the
LibvirtNonblockingTestCase.test_tpool_execute_calls_libvirt which ran when
the value was changed causing this test to fail. This only occurred when we
the test_libvirt used the fake libvirt driver, which happens when the tests
run inside a virtualenv environment.

Change-Id: I68c30dffd05daae6c0d5fbc6ec005c0fab4f09be
Closes-Bug: 1258553
"}]
commit_message:
Fix race in unit tests, which can cause gate job to fail

The FakeLibvirtTests.test_openAuth_can_refuse_None_uri test changes the value
of the global variable allow_default_uri_connection. We need to clean up this
change up after running this test so as we don't effect other tests that
expect the value of this variable to be the default.

In particular this test was running before the
LibvirtNonblockingTestCase.test_tpool_execute_calls_libvirt which ran when
the value was changed causing this test to fail. This only occurred when we
the test_libvirt used the fake libvirt driver, which happens when the tests
run inside a virtualenv environment.

Change-Id: I68c30dffd05daae6c0d5fbc6ec005c0fab4f09be
Closes-Bug: 1258553

subject: Add test-requirements to all tox jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-12-10 14:59:36.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Add test-requirements to all tox jobs

With the addition of unit tests to tempest that have requirements
in the test-requirements.txt the regular tempest jobs will fail
during test discovery. This is because the packages in
test-requirements aren't being installed which will cause an import
error when subunit imports the unit test file. This commit gets
around the issue by installing the packages in test-requirements for
every tox job.

Change-Id: I00e66fae2dfe123dd3b5769265a9d64f913c00a5
"}]
commit_message:
Add test-requirements to all tox jobs

With the addition of unit tests to tempest that have requirements
in the test-requirements.txt the regular tempest jobs will fail
during test discovery. This is because the packages in
test-requirements aren't being installed which will cause an import
error when subunit imports the unit test file. This commit gets
around the issue by installing the packages in test-requirements for
every tox job.

Change-Id: I00e66fae2dfe123dd3b5769265a9d64f913c00a5

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-16 19:49:26.000000000', 'files': ['elements/cinder/os-refresh-config/migration.d/72-cinder-resize-volume-groups'], 'message': 'Make cinder loopback config idempotent

If this script is run twice for some reason, it will attach more and
more loopback devices to the backing file which is problematic. Using -j
will use the first device if one has already been attached.

Change-Id: Idcc84b308e1edcdb9ab819f2f4a5fc465ef5661e
'}]
commit_message:
Make cinder loopback config idempotent

If this script is run twice for some reason, it will attach more and
more loopback devices to the backing file which is problematic. Using -j
will use the first device if one has already been attached.

Change-Id: Idcc84b308e1edcdb9ab819f2f4a5fc465ef5661e

subject: Filter out LVM block devices for cinder
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-16 19:49:26.000000000', 'files': ['elements/cinder/os-refresh-config/migration.d/72-cinder-resize-volume-groups'], 'message': 'Filter out LVM block devices for cinder

Cinder may create physical LVM volumes which might be picked up by the
operating system and treated the wrong way. We can be explicit in the
filter and only allow our loopback device to be seen by pvscan.

Change-Id: I73a5b8ed0c3989ff61a3005cb70acd8a95532271
Closes-Bug: #1261422
'}]
commit_message:
Filter out LVM block devices for cinder

Cinder may create physical LVM volumes which might be picked up by the
operating system and treated the wrong way. We can be explicit in the
filter and only allow our loopback device to be seen by pvscan.

Change-Id: I73a5b8ed0c3989ff61a3005cb70acd8a95532271
Closes-Bug: #1261422

commit_message:
Method to generate PXE options for Neutron ports

Add a new method to generate the structure containing the PXE
bootfile-name, server-ip-address, and tftp-server information.
This information will be used to provide Neutron DHCP options
to set up the PXE booting of nodes. This patch does not actually pass
the data to Neutron, however.

Change-Id: Iadf5b803bb5a5465fc2adcb94fa3fd2a756340be

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 1955, 'name': 'Alan Pevec', 'email': 'alan.pevec@redhat.com', 'username': 'apevec'}, {'_account_id': 2592, 'name': 'Mark McClain', 'email': 'mark@mcclain.xyz', 'username': 'markmcclain'}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 6659, 'name': 'Paul Michali', 'email': 'pc@michali.net', 'username': 'pcm'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-11 14:51:06.000000000', 'files': ['quantum/agent/metadata/agent.py', 'quantum/tests/unit/test_metadata_agent.py'], 'message': "Add X-Tenant-ID to metadata request

Previously, one could update a port's device_id to be that of
another tenant's instance_id and then be able to retrieve that
instance's metadata. In order to prevent this X-Tenant-ID is now
passed in the metadata request to nova and nova then checks that
X-Tenant-ID also matches the tenant_id for the instance against it's
database to ensure it's not being spoofed.

DocImpact - When upgrading OpenStack nova and neturon, neutron
            should be updated first (and neutron-metadata-agent
            restarted before nova is upgraded) in order to minimize
            downtime. This is because there is also a patch to nova
            which has checks X-Tenant-ID against it's database
            therefore neutron-metadata-agent needs to pass that
            before nova is upgraded for metadata to work.

Change-Id: I2b8fa2f561a7f2914608e68133abf15efa95015a
Closes-Bug: #1235450
"}]
commit_message:
Add X-Tenant-ID to metadata request

Previously, one could update a port's device_id to be that of
another tenant's instance_id and then be able to retrieve that
instance's metadata. In order to prevent this X-Tenant-ID is now
passed in the metadata request to nova and nova then checks that
X-Tenant-ID also matches the tenant_id for the instance against it's
database to ensure it's not being spoofed.

DocImpact - When upgrading OpenStack nova and neturon, neutron
            should be updated first (and neutron-metadata-agent
            restarted before nova is upgraded) in order to minimize
            downtime. This is because there is also a patch to nova
            which has checks X-Tenant-ID against it's database
            therefore neutron-metadata-agent needs to pass that
            before nova is upgraded for metadata to work.

Change-Id: I2b8fa2f561a7f2914608e68133abf15efa95015a
Closes-Bug: #1235450

subject: Move decision_maker() call into setUpClass
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-16 15:33:55.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/thirdparty/boto/test.py', 'test-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Move decision_maker() call into setUpClass

Previously the class level call of decision_maker() to detect certain
configuration details for the boto tests was mad in the class
definition. This has issues with unit testing because it requires a
functional config at import time for the file. This commit avoids this
restriction by moving this call into setUpClass for BotoTestCase which
won't try to execute decision_maker() at import.

This commit also pins sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error.

Change-Id: I8abf4ae109576499fed6b31ae644c1bac58e3350
(cherry picked from commit f054a9c5f103a0e30e66f69c8f7872097feb3af3)
"}]
commit_message:
Move decision_maker() call into setUpClass

Previously the class level call of decision_maker() to detect certain
configuration details for the boto tests was mad in the class
definition. This has issues with unit testing because it requires a
functional config at import time for the file. This commit avoids this
restriction by moving this call into setUpClass for BotoTestCase which
won't try to execute decision_maker() at import.

This commit also pins sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error.

Change-Id: I8abf4ae109576499fed6b31ae644c1bac58e3350
(cherry picked from commit f054a9c5f103a0e30e66f69c8f7872097feb3af3)

commit_message:
Revert graceful shutdown patch

aka: "Stop, Rescue, and Delete should give guest a chance to shutdown"

This reverts commit b32d01d44ca5711c96d192df51bf7acd34f52556.

Unfortunately this patch had an unintended side effect that we didn't
notice until after it was merged.  It adds about 25 minutes to tempest
runs, which isn't really acceptable in the gate.  We need to revert this
until we can sort that out.

Change-Id: Ibdd5c86e60b5ede4ec1a38d9efa7c94d60de1720

commit_message:
Replace Celery with Oslo messaging for asynchronous queuing.

Barbican is using Celery to interface to the HA queues it uses to send
asynchronous requests from API nodes to the worker nodes. This change
request replaces Celery with OpenStack-friendly oslo.messaging RPC
components.

Change-Id: Ibc257e98726938a577da4300b389fa13ff34d8a0
Implements: blueprint queue-use-oslo-messaging

commit_message:
Give migrations tests more time to run

Migrations tests usually take longer to run that most other
tests. Increase the time out value just for migrations tests,
so that we don't hit various time out errors running unit tests
when CI test nodes slow down a bit.

Closes-Bug: #1216851

Change-Id: I48d7c125397cd282d52eb8e1a1ccb699188d8f14

commit_message:
Make it possible to override test timeout value

Currently, we are setting the test timeout value globally
in .testr.conf. It could be useful to be able to override
it per test case (e.g. for migrations tests which usually
take much longer to run than any other tests).

Related-Bug: #1216851

Change-Id: Icee09609f76f4439f6d981641be521d8d695a77e

commit_message:
Adjust import order according to PEP8 imports rule

This patch just adjust import order to follow PEP8 imports rule.
See http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0008/#imports

Imports should be grouped in the following order:
1) Standard library imports
2) Related third party imports
3) Local application/library specific imports

Change-Id: Ifa3f219207b02d60e757e17c42dae1fef2f628fe

subject: Make Serializer/Conductor able to backlevel objects
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2013-12-16 15:25:31.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/base.py', 'nova/conductor/rpcapi.py', 'nova/conductor/api.py', 'nova/tests/objects/test_objects.py', 'nova/conductor/manager.py'], 'message': "Make Serializer/Conductor able to backlevel objects

This improves handling the situation where nova-api sends newer
objects to an older compute node. In this case, the serializer detects
the IncompatibleObjectVersion error and asks conductor to backlevel it.
This means we call into a new method in conductor with the primitive
object that we can't handle, and basically ask it to hydrate it and
call obj_make_compatible() on our behalf and pass it back to us.

This eliminates the need for API to know whether it's talking to
an older compute and allows a newer conductor to assist older
compute nodes during upgrades to a significant degree.

Related-Bug: #1258256
Change-Id: I4b17c8382619e4f73b83c026bf68549ac67a68a2
"}]
commit_message:
Make Serializer/Conductor able to backlevel objects

This improves handling the situation where nova-api sends newer
objects to an older compute node. In this case, the serializer detects
the IncompatibleObjectVersion error and asks conductor to backlevel it.
This means we call into a new method in conductor with the primitive
object that we can't handle, and basically ask it to hydrate it and
call obj_make_compatible() on our behalf and pass it back to us.

This eliminates the need for API to know whether it's talking to
an older compute and allows a newer conductor to assist older
compute nodes during upgrades to a significant degree.

Related-Bug: #1258256
Change-Id: I4b17c8382619e4f73b83c026bf68549ac67a68a2

commit_message:
LVM migrate: Use keywords for the brick instance

In the `migrate_volume` method a new instance is created when the
dest_vg is not equal to the source vg. This new brick instance is
created using positional arguments instead of keywords. However, some of
those arguments are passed in the wrong positions.

This patch uses keywords for the misplaced arguments.

The patch also changes `test_lvm_migrate_volume_proceed` in order to
fully test the happy path and catch things like this.

Closes-bug: #1258128
(cherry picked from commit 69ce114232f9102220b45c8242eda3e78872a3e6)

Conflicts:
	cinder/volume/drivers/lvm.py

Change-Id: I75cf91171709554053fd5b52a4aae4e176e8364e

commit_message:
VMware: fix bug when more than one datacenter exists

In the case that there was more than one datacenter defined on the VC,
then spawning an instance would result in an exception. The reason for this
was that the nova compute would not set the correct datacenter for the
selected datastore.

The fix also takes care of the correct folder selection. This too was a
result of not selecting the correct folder for the data center.

The 'fake' configuration was updated to contain an additional data
center with its on datastore.

Closes-Bug: #1180044
Closes-Bug: #1214850

Co-authored-by: Shawn Harsock <hartsocks@vmware.com>

Change-Id: Ib61811fffcbc80385efc3166c9e366fdaa6432bd

subject: Normalize the weights instead of using raw values
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 91, 'name': 'Alvaro', 'email': 'aloga@ifca.unican.es', 'username': 'aloga'}, {'_account_id': 642, 'name': 'Matt Dietz', 'email': 'matthew.dietz@gmail.com', 'username': 'cerberus'}, {'_account_id': 1030, 'name': 'Chris Behrens', 'email': 'cbehrens@codestud.com', 'username': 'cbehrens'}, {'_account_id': 1501, 'name': 'Phil Day', 'email': 'philip.day@hp.com', 'username': 'philip-day'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2835, 'name': 'Brian Elliott', 'email': 'bdelliott@gmail.com', 'username': 'belliott'}, {'_account_id': 4190, 'name': 'lifeless', 'email': 'robertc@robertcollins.net', 'username': 'lifeless'}, {'_account_id': 5652, 'name': 'David Ripton', 'email': 'dripton@redhat.com', 'username': 'dripton'}, {'_account_id': 6450, 'name': 'Hans Lindgren', 'email': 'hanlind@kth.se', 'username': 'hanlind'}, {'_account_id': 6681, 'name': 'Brent Eagles', 'email': 'beagles@redhat.com', 'username': 'beagles'}, {'_account_id': 7494, 'name': 'Guangya Liu', 'email': 'gyliu513@gmail.com', 'username': 'JayLau'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 31, 'created': '2013-12-11 19:26:46.000000000', 'files': ['nova/cells/weights/weight_offset.py', 'nova/cells/weights/ram_by_instance_type.py', 'etc/nova/nova.conf.sample', 'nova/scheduler/weights/metrics.py', 'nova/tests/test_weights.py', 'nova/cells/weights/mute_child.py', 'doc/source/devref/filter_scheduler.rst', 'nova/scheduler/weights/ram.py', 'nova/tests/cells/test_cells_weights.py', 'nova/tests/scheduler/test_weights.py', 'nova/weights.py'], 'message': "Normalize the weights instead of using raw values

The weight system is being used by the scheduler and the cells code.
Currently this system is using the raw values instead of normalizing them.
This makes difficult to properly use multipliers for establishing the
relative importance between two wheighers (one big magnitude could
shade a smaller one). This change introduces weight normalization so
that:

- From an operator point of view we can prioritize the weighers that
  we are applying. The only way to do this is being sure that all the
  weighers will give a value in a known range, so that it is
  not needed to artificially use a huge multiplier to prioritize a
  weigher.

- From a weigher developer point of view, somebody willing to implement
  one has to care about 1) returning a list of values, 2) setting the
  minimum and maximum values where the weights can range, if they are
  needed and they are significant for the weighing. For a weigher
  developer there are two use cases:

    Case 1: Use of a percentage instead of absolute values (for example, %
    of free RAM). If we compare two nodes focusing on the percentage of free
    ram, the maximum value for the weigher is 100. If we have two nodes one
    with 2048 total/1024 free, and the second one 1024 total/512 free they
    will get both the same weight, since they have the same % of free RAM
    (that is, the 50%).

    Case 2: Use of absolute values. In this case, the maximum of the weigher
    will be the maximum of the values in the list (in the case above, 1024)
    or the maximum value that the magnitude could take (in the case above,
    2048). How this maximum is set, is a decision of the developer. He may
    let the operator choose the behaviour of the weigher though.

- From the point of view of the scheduler we ensure that it is using
  normalized values, and not leveraging the normalization mechanism to the
  weighers.

Changes introduced this commit:

1) it introduces weight normalization so that we can apply multipliers
   easily. All the weights for an object will be normalized between 0.0 and
   1.0 before being sumed up, so that the final weight for a host will be:

    weight = w1_multiplier * norm(w1) + w2_multiplier * norm(w2) + ...

2) weights.BaseWeigher has been changed into an ABC so that we enforce
   that all weighers have the expected methods.

3) weights.BaseWeigher.weigh_objects() does no longer sum up the
   computer weighs to the object, but it rather returns a list that will be
   then normalized and added to the existing weight by BaseWeightHandler

4) Adapt the existing weighers to the above changes. Namely
    - New 'offset_weight_multiplier' for the cell weigher
      nova.cells.weights.weight_offset.WeightOffsetWeigher
    - Changed the name of the existing multiplier methods.

5) unittests for all of the introduced changes.

Implements blueprint normalize-scheduler-weights

DocImpact: Now weights for an object are normalized before suming them
up. This means that each weigher will take a maximum value of 1. This
may have an impact for operators that are using more than one weigher
(currently there is only one weigher: RAMWeiger) and for operators using
cells (where we have several weighers). It is needed to review then the
multipliers used and adjust them properly in case they have been
modified.

Docimpact: There is a new configuration option 'offset_weight_multiplier'
in nova.cells.weights.weight_offset.WeightOffsetWeigher

Change-Id: I81bf90898d3cb81541f4390596823cc00106eb20
"}]
commit_message:
Normalize the weights instead of using raw values

The weight system is being used by the scheduler and the cells code.
Currently this system is using the raw values instead of normalizing them.
This makes difficult to properly use multipliers for establishing the
relative importance between two wheighers (one big magnitude could
shade a smaller one). This change introduces weight normalization so
that:

- From an operator point of view we can prioritize the weighers that
  we are applying. The only way to do this is being sure that all the
  weighers will give a value in a known range, so that it is
  not needed to artificially use a huge multiplier to prioritize a
  weigher.

- From a weigher developer point of view, somebody willing to implement
  one has to care about 1) returning a list of values, 2) setting the
  minimum and maximum values where the weights can range, if they are
  needed and they are significant for the weighing. For a weigher
  developer there are two use cases:

    Case 1: Use of a percentage instead of absolute values (for example, %
    of free RAM). If we compare two nodes focusing on the percentage of free
    ram, the maximum value for the weigher is 100. If we have two nodes one
    with 2048 total/1024 free, and the second one 1024 total/512 free they
    will get both the same weight, since they have the same % of free RAM
    (that is, the 50%).

    Case 2: Use of absolute values. In this case, the maximum of the weigher
    will be the maximum of the values in the list (in the case above, 1024)
    or the maximum value that the magnitude could take (in the case above,
    2048). How this maximum is set, is a decision of the developer. He may
    let the operator choose the behaviour of the weigher though.

- From the point of view of the scheduler we ensure that it is using
  normalized values, and not leveraging the normalization mechanism to the
  weighers.

Changes introduced this commit:

1) it introduces weight normalization so that we can apply multipliers
   easily. All the weights for an object will be normalized between 0.0 and
   1.0 before being sumed up, so that the final weight for a host will be:

    weight = w1_multiplier * norm(w1) + w2_multiplier * norm(w2) + ...

2) weights.BaseWeigher has been changed into an ABC so that we enforce
   that all weighers have the expected methods.

3) weights.BaseWeigher.weigh_objects() does no longer sum up the
   computer weighs to the object, but it rather returns a list that will be
   then normalized and added to the existing weight by BaseWeightHandler

4) Adapt the existing weighers to the above changes. Namely
    - New 'offset_weight_multiplier' for the cell weigher
      nova.cells.weights.weight_offset.WeightOffsetWeigher
    - Changed the name of the existing multiplier methods.

5) unittests for all of the introduced changes.

Implements blueprint normalize-scheduler-weights

DocImpact: Now weights for an object are normalized before suming them
up. This means that each weigher will take a maximum value of 1. This
may have an impact for operators that are using more than one weigher
(currently there is only one weigher: RAMWeiger) and for operators using
cells (where we have several weighers). It is needed to review then the
multipliers used and adjust them properly in case they have been
modified.

Docimpact: There is a new configuration option 'offset_weight_multiplier'
in nova.cells.weights.weight_offset.WeightOffsetWeigher

Change-Id: I81bf90898d3cb81541f4390596823cc00106eb20

subject: Merge force-text-mode-console into the bootloader script
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-16 13:08:41.000000000', 'files': ['elements/vm/finalise.d/51-bootloader', 'elements/vm/finalise.d/52-force-text-mode-console'], 'message': 'Merge force-text-mode-console into the bootloader script

52-force-text-mode-console, running after 51-bootloader, calls
grub2-mkconfig (on Ubuntu that will happen via the update-grub call).
This call will overwrite all the changes that 51-bootloader did to the
grub.cfg. By merging the 52-force-text-mode-console code into
51-bootloader we avoid that. This also means that 51-bootloader will now
call grub2-mkconfig regardless of whether there is already and existing
grub2 configuration or not (52-force-text-mode-console did that in the
past anyway).

Additionally this commit enables the force to textmode code for openSUSE
(was previously only working correctly for Ubuntu and Fedora).

Closes-Bug: #1260323
Change-Id: Ida8e1a69df22d41ad70eb7154707c50613b536a8
'}]
commit_message:
Merge force-text-mode-console into the bootloader script

52-force-text-mode-console, running after 51-bootloader, calls
grub2-mkconfig (on Ubuntu that will happen via the update-grub call).
This call will overwrite all the changes that 51-bootloader did to the
grub.cfg. By merging the 52-force-text-mode-console code into
51-bootloader we avoid that. This also means that 51-bootloader will now
call grub2-mkconfig regardless of whether there is already and existing
grub2 configuration or not (52-force-text-mode-console did that in the
past anyway).

Additionally this commit enables the force to textmode code for openSUSE
(was previously only working correctly for Ubuntu and Fedora).

Closes-Bug: #1260323
Change-Id: Ida8e1a69df22d41ad70eb7154707c50613b536a8

revisions:

Change-Id: Ic7042728e64159c83431c11eb1ab1bba6e7e656c

commit_message:
Fix cinder element to make volumes persistent

The element's os-refresh-config script was failing because
/var/run/cinder does not exist. It does not exist because /var/run
is usually tmpfs or cleared out before boot proceeds.

Closes-Bug: #1261403
Change-Id: Ic7042728e64159c83431c11eb1ab1bba6e7e656c

commit_message:
Adds included-template-dir param for resolving template FileIncludes

In I587fa7a826f93f89e8e5c266af7f5765438fe738 there is a problem with
the overcloud.yaml Make target. Once the merge.py script is moved from
where the templates are, FileInclude paths cannot be resolved relative
to the script. The included-template-path defaults to './'

Change-Id: I220c5e52d8062e98aa28a1c582e29c7e844bc9ae

 in DHCP mode and have to wait for timeout.

Resolves-bug #1260879

'}]
commit_message:
Move Fake objects to a special tests.fakes module

A set of Fake objects originally created for nova scenarios unit tests
turned out to be very useful for several other unit tests as well. Here,
we move all these Fake objects to a special tests.fakes module. This will
also simplify code reuse in future unit tests.

Blueprint unit-tests-refactoring

Change-Id: I2b3c6a3f1543a186fe498d886e3fd4bfe615dce8

revisions:

Running the stress test framework without any tempest.conf causes
an error. This is due to the fact that the admin client expects the
configuration file. This causes error while doing pep8 checks (see
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/56308/)

Pin sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: I69b3d83185d1b144474314402ad5449980d6ffbc
Co-Authored-By: "James E. Blair" <jeblair@openstack.org>
Co-Authored-By: Marc Koderer <m.koderer@telekom.de>
Fixes: bug #1251663

commit_message:
Move admin client initialization into stress-openstack

Running the stress test framework without any tempest.conf causes
an error. This is due to the fact that the admin client expects the
configuration file. This causes error while doing pep8 checks (see
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/56308/)

Pin sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: I69b3d83185d1b144474314402ad5449980d6ffbc
Co-Authored-By: "James E. Blair" <jeblair@openstack.org>
Co-Authored-By: Marc Koderer <m.koderer@telekom.de>
Fixes: bug #1251663

This patch removes new definitions of common network type constants (TYPE_FLAT,
TYPE_LOCAL, etc.) and modifies uses of aforementioned constants to a common
place where constants are defined (neutron.plugins.common.constants). This
patch does not change values that are equal in value but different in name:
NETWORK_TYPE_FLAT vs TYPE_FLAT. A second changeset will be made to handle that

commit_message:
Update common network type consts to same origin

This patch removes new definitions of common network type constants (TYPE_FLAT,
TYPE_LOCAL, etc.) and modifies uses of aforementioned constants to a common
place where constants are defined (neutron.plugins.common.constants). This
patch does not change values that are equal in value but different in name:
NETWORK_TYPE_FLAT vs TYPE_FLAT. A second changeset will be made to handle that
case.

Unit tests were modified as well when they referred to the constant.

Finally, the ovs agent code refers to the OVS plugin constants directly and
these had to be changed as well. A TODO flag was put in that file due to use
of another plugin specific constant.

Network types that were only defined in a single plugin, such as mellanox's
infiniband (IB) network type was not carried over to the common constants file.

Fixes-bug: #1196170

Change-Id: Ib6bfc8275496a24bf247946d177c734b62ae44bb

commit_message:
Export OS_SVC_ENABLE_CONTROl in upstart jobs

Without this export os-svc-enable.conf never sees the starting event and
thus never does anything to prevent starting the job.

Change-Id: Ib94c817ce3f2e6c3aada1515beea6e7fb41605af

commit_message:
Fix os-svc-daemon missing env in upstart jobs

Recent changes landed to set the environment variable
OS_SVC_ENABLE_CONTROL=1 but the env statement was left out, rendering
the upstart job completely broken as the syntax is now invalid.

Change-Id: I88a7a63304d1fe759067e47e2fab88ee27f91914

Closes-Bug: #1257169

commit_message:
create os-image-upload role and change the order of
os-image-api and os-image-registry roles.

Create a new role os-image-upload and change the execution order of
os-image-api and os-image-registry roles in os-image role to make sure
the os-image-api role is executed before os-image-registry role since
glance db_sync use the sql_connection value in
/etc/glance/glance-api.conf.
Add os-image-upload to infrastructure.yml.
Remove the image_upload attribute from environments.

Change-Id: I218b52e1fd0ca68849e6aebd8bac6d8878790fba
Closes-Bug: #1257169

commit_message:
Run neutron-db-manage upgrade.

before starting neutron-server and any associated plugins.

 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/40296/

NOTE: Some of the dev tools already take this approach as well.

commit_message:
Missing LVM package install step on Ubuntu

The Cinder Block Storage service node guide was missing a
step to install the lvm2 packages. These packages needed
to be installed before the pvcreate and vgcreate steps
were initiated.

Change-Id: I7b85b962f8652667dd9df18b470430f9063a89f8
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: 1259443

commit_message:
Modify the Case Study name to represent content

The case studies in the Security Guide are all provided with
a basic chapter title of "Case Study". There's no clarity as
to which chapter they represent. For readability and usability
this should be updated so that both the index and document
content are accurate.

Change-Id: Id27f8512c26189ce9e2edbf6f605692e581bcddc
Closes-Bug: 1248918

As reported to Launchpad, the creation of the base networks
document expects the user to create one or more initial tenants.
Whilst this has been done in prior steps, it's not clear, or
obvious how to do it. I've added a basic one-liner and linked
to relevant supporting documents in the install-guide.

Changes also fix a minor typo and append the "--tenant-id"
parameter to the user input sections where required.

Change-Id: I8ef3d3c69a5b10a9a4906f4249da1605f9a01e4c

Closes-Bug: 1261165

commit_message:
Added Tenant-Create step to Create Base Networks

As reported to Launchpad, the creation of the base networks
document expects the user to create one or more initial tenants.
Whilst this has been done in prior steps, it's not clear, or
obvious how to do it. I've added a basic one-liner and linked
to relevant supporting documents in the install-guide.

Changes also fix a minor typo and append the "--tenant-id"
parameter to the user input sections where required.

Change-Id: I8ef3d3c69a5b10a9a4906f4249da1605f9a01e4c
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: 1261165
