commit_message:
Add ostf failed tests names and meesages in assert

In case if tests failed in method assert_ostf_run
there is no quick way to understand what exectly fail

Add failed_test_names variable,
that populated by failed ostf test names and error message
in assertTrue method. Value on this variable
will show only if AssertTrue fail.

Change-Id: Ib4475835c129a3240b9f3c270a3aa8de3d12a966

subject: Glance: make logging configurable...
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-15 21:12:30.000000000', 'files': ['elements/glance/os-config-applier/etc/glance/glance-registry.conf', 'elements/glance/os-config-applier/etc/glance/logging.conf', 'elements/glance/os-config-applier/etc/glance/glance-scrubber.conf', 'elements/glance/README.md', 'elements/glance/install.d/75-glance', 'elements/glance/os-config-applier/etc/glance/glance-api.conf', 'elements/glance/os-config-applier/etc/glance/glance-cache.conf'], 'message': 'Glance: make logging configurable...

Adds top level glance.debug and glance.verbose config parameters
to control Glance logging.

As part of this change we are also:

 - Dropping --debug from the service config files. This cause the
  previous Glance log configuration to always log at the DEBUG level.

 - Remove the logging.conf file. The previous log file was also set
  to log at a DEBUG level. To get the same effect you can now
  just enable verbose/debug.

 - Drop --log-config from the service config files. We do this because
  we are dropping logging.conf.

 - Remove log_file from glance-api.conf and glance-registry.conf. This
  gives us the same behaviour as before where Glance logged using the
  init system logger.

The motivation for this change is primarily two things:

1) Glance should log at the WARNING level by default in production.
 (Not DEBUG as it did previously)

2) When making use of this element for CI we may want to more easily
 control the log level (and default to DEBUG). Using the new
 glance.debug and glance.verbose element parameters will make this
 easier.

Change-Id: I20e83682af0a46e455ba8f216bbd5e2f1e04ec16
'}]
commit_message:
Glance: make logging configurable...

Adds top level glance.debug and glance.verbose config parameters
to control Glance logging.

As part of this change we are also:

 - Dropping --debug from the service config files. This cause the
  previous Glance log configuration to always log at the DEBUG level.

 - Remove the logging.conf file. The previous log file was also set
  to log at a DEBUG level. To get the same effect you can now
  just enable verbose/debug.

 - Drop --log-config from the service config files. We do this because
  we are dropping logging.conf.

 - Remove log_file from glance-api.conf and glance-registry.conf. This
  gives us the same behaviour as before where Glance logged using the
  init system logger.

The motivation for this change is primarily two things:

1) Glance should log at the WARNING level by default in production.
 (Not DEBUG as it did previously)

2) When making use of this element for CI we may want to more easily
 control the log level (and default to DEBUG). Using the new
 glance.debug and glance.verbose element parameters will make this
 easier.

Change-Id: I20e83682af0a46e455ba8f216bbd5e2f1e04ec16

[{'number': 33, 'created': '2013-12-15 16:31:46.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/cells/test_cells_rpcapi.py', 'nova/tests/cells/test_cells_messaging.py', 'nova/tests/api/ec2/test_cloud.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/cells/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_rpcapi.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/compute/rpcapi.py', 'nova/cells/rpcapi.py', 'nova/compute/api.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute_cells.py', 'nova/virt/fake.py', 'nova/virt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/cells/test_cells_manager.py', 'nova/cells/messaging.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_shelve.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/driver.py', 'nova/compute/cells_api.py', 'etc/nova/nova.conf.sample', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/test_virt_drivers.py', 'nova/virt/baremetal/driver.py'], 'message': "Stop, Rescue, and Delete should give guest a chance to shutdown

Currently in libvirt stop, shelve, rescue, and delete simply
destroy the underlying VM. Some GuestOS's do not react well to this
type of power failure, and so it would be better if these operations
followed the same approach as soft_reboot and give the guest as
chance to shutdown gracefully.  Even where VM is being deleted,
it may be booted from a volume which will be reused on another
server.

The change is implemented by adding a clean_shutdown parameter
to the relevant methods from the compute/api layer downwards
and into the virt drivers.  The implementation in the libvirt
driver is also provided.  Other drivers are modified just to
expect the additional parameter.

The timer configuration value previous used by soft_reboot in
libvirt is moved up to virt/driver so it can be used by other drivers.

The timer logic itself is changed from simple loop counting with one
second sleeps to a more precise approach, since testing showed that
other calls in the loop could introduce a difference of up to +50% on
the expected duration. This can extent the default two minute to
three minutes, which would not be acceptable in some environments
and breaks some of the tempest tests.

A separate config value defines what the default shutdown
behaviour for delete should be (default False to keep compatibility
with current behaviour).

This code is structured to enable a subsequent API change to add
clean/forced options to the stop and delete methods

Also as a minor tidy-up moved the repeated definition of
FakeLoopingCall in test_libvirt be common across tests

Partially-Implements: blueprint user-defined-shutdown
Closes-Bug: #1196924

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ie69aa2621cb52d6fefdc19f664247b069d6782ee
"}]
commit_message:
Stop, Rescue, and Delete should give guest a chance to shutdown

Currently in libvirt stop, shelve, rescue, and delete simply
destroy the underlying VM. Some GuestOS's do not react well to this
type of power failure, and so it would be better if these operations
followed the same approach as soft_reboot and give the guest as
chance to shutdown gracefully.  Even where VM is being deleted,
it may be booted from a volume which will be reused on another
server.

The change is implemented by adding a clean_shutdown parameter
to the relevant methods from the compute/api layer downwards
and into the virt drivers.  The implementation in the libvirt
driver is also provided.  Other drivers are modified just to
expect the additional parameter.

The timer configuration value previous used by soft_reboot in
libvirt is moved up to virt/driver so it can be used by other drivers.

The timer logic itself is changed from simple loop counting with one
second sleeps to a more precise approach, since testing showed that
other calls in the loop could introduce a difference of up to +50% on
the expected duration. This can extent the default two minute to
three minutes, which would not be acceptable in some environments
and breaks some of the tempest tests.

A separate config value defines what the default shutdown
behaviour for delete should be (default False to keep compatibility
with current behaviour).

This code is structured to enable a subsequent API change to add
clean/forced options to the stop and delete methods

Also as a minor tidy-up moved the repeated definition of
FakeLoopingCall in test_libvirt be common across tests

Partially-Implements: blueprint user-defined-shutdown
Closes-Bug: #1196924

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ie69aa2621cb52d6fefdc19f664247b069d6782ee

subject: Consolidate rootwrap settings for neutron element
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-13 18:49:15.000000000', 'files': ['elements/neutron/os-config-applier/etc/neutron/dhcp_agent.ini', 'elements/neutron/os-config-applier/etc/neutron/neutron.conf', 'elements/neutron/os-config-applier/etc/neutron/plugins/openvswitch/ovs_neutron_plugin.ini'], 'message': 'Consolidate rootwrap settings for neutron element

Moves the root_helper settings for the DHCP and OVS agents
into the common neutron.conf file.

This actually removes a deprecation WARNING from the dhcp agent
logs as well:

commit_message:
Consolidate rootwrap settings for neutron element

Moves the root_helper settings for the DHCP and OVS agents
into the common neutron.conf file.

This actually removes a deprecation WARNING from the dhcp agent
logs as well:

Deprecated: DEFAULT.root_helper is deprecated! Please move root_helper
configuration to [AGENT] section.

Change-Id: I79251984ab86b34590dc89139f3c7d02d6175714

commit_message:
Add POWER_MANAGER support to devtest.

Adds an optional POWER_MANAGER option to devtest which can be
used to control the power manager used within the seed and undercloud
images. This can be useful when using the devtest scripts w/ real
hardware.

This support already exists in tripleo-ci and once included in the
devtest scripts will make switching to the devtest scripts in
tripleo-ci easier.

Change-Id: I976aa2f89e965dc9024e7967d7e593fb1f874000

commit_message:
Pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

commit_message:
Fix closing cinder.keymgr tag

The tag ending the cinder.keymgr namespace in cinder.conf was in error a
second opening tag. This surprisingly resulted in everything above the
keystone_authtoken section not being included in the written out file.

Change-Id: Ib758c350e28980d308b78deff45f81c23da43ebe

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-16 09:53:25.000000000', 'files': ['docs/develop/pxe_deployment.rst'], 'message': "Do not extract ISO with 7z and use mount + rsync instead

Closes-Bug: #1260673

During ISO extraction 7z replaces ':' symbols with '_' and truncates some long file names
for Ubuntu packages which breaks Ubuntu deployment.
Example of broken files after extraction:
bsdutils_1:2.20.1-1ubuntu3_amd64.deb => bsdutils_1_2.20.1-1ubuntu3_amd64.deb
busybox-initramfs_1:1.18.5-1ubuntu4_amd64.deb => busybox-initramfs_1_1.18.5-1ubuntu4_amd64.deb

Change-Id: I4badfcda29c74febb756c6a45b0ed1296cf101a7
"}]
commit_message:
Do not extract ISO with 7z and use mount + rsync instead

Closes-Bug: #1260673

During ISO extraction 7z replaces ':' symbols with '_' and truncates some long file names
for Ubuntu packages which breaks Ubuntu deployment.
Example of broken files after extraction:
bsdutils_1:2.20.1-1ubuntu3_amd64.deb => bsdutils_1_2.20.1-1ubuntu3_amd64.deb
busybox-initramfs_1:1.18.5-1ubuntu4_amd64.deb => busybox-initramfs_1_1.18.5-1ubuntu4_amd64.deb

Change-Id: I4badfcda29c74febb756c6a45b0ed1296cf101a7

commit_message:
Adding neutron support in openstack-compute

Adding neutron support. It is a search and replace of
quantum with neutron in all the files. Also, set 8.0.0
as the version in metadata.rb. The version was not bumped
when stable/grizzly was branched. Also, updated the
dependency cookbook versions in metadata.rb.

Change-Id: Ia53ffcb0a6fbf322784fb6409adc5386b3e7dd40
Implemented: blueprint neutron-support

commit_message:
[vbox] Increasing memory/disk size in vbox scripts.

Closes-Bug: #1253097
Closes-Bug: #1260244

When controller is deployed with Ceph,
768Mb of RAM is not enough. So we have
to increase the default amount of memory
required to run demo environment.
Also, as we now give more space on
controllers for root partition, increased
default disk size as well.

Change-Id: I791f26c94c54ce6be48116fc2eaa9e6464da5738

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-12-12 22:24:36.000000000', 'files': ['heat/db/api.py', 'heat/engine/parser.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'heat/tests/test_sqlalchemy_api.py'], 'message': "Fix stack_get_by_name does not list nested stack issue

The nested stack's owner_id is not None. When querying a result
filtered with owner_id=None, then nested stacks will not be
listed. The fix is to filter stack_get_by_name by stack name only and
add a new API stack_get_by_name_and_owner_id to filter via stack name
and owner id.

Change-Id: I659104f4936b567222108c211f77473ef35638c6
Closes-Bug: #1240892
"}]
commit_message:
Fix stack_get_by_name does not list nested stack issue

The nested stack's owner_id is not None. When querying a result
filtered with owner_id=None, then nested stacks will not be
listed. The fix is to filter stack_get_by_name by stack name only and
add a new API stack_get_by_name_and_owner_id to filter via stack name
and owner id.

Change-Id: I659104f4936b567222108c211f77473ef35638c6
Closes-Bug: #1240892

A checkout listener can be added to sqlalchemy to be able to handle
database disconnect pessimistically and avoid an error in the event of
a DB restart or simply a temp connection issue due to network
glitches. At the moment only mysql is enabled with this feature. This
patch enables db2 as well.

Sync oslo db.sqlalchemy from commit：
bb4d7a2534f6087d828e22784dc263522d309592

Partial-Bug: #1231657

Change-Id: Ib89de07f004975528baffdfd19aae689b089a324

commit_message:
Enables db2 server disconnects to be handled pessimistically

A checkout listener can be added to sqlalchemy to be able to handle
database disconnect pessimistically and avoid an error in the event of
a DB restart or simply a temp connection issue due to network
glitches. At the moment only mysql is enabled with this feature. This
patch enables db2 as well.

Sync oslo db.sqlalchemy from commit：
bb4d7a2534f6087d828e22784dc263522d309592

Partial-Bug: #1231657

Change-Id: Ib89de07f004975528baffdfd19aae689b089a324

subject: Make negative snapshot tests faster
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-15 01:06:29.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/images/test_images_oneserver_negative.py'], 'message': 'Make negative snapshot tests faster

test_delete_image_that_is_not_yet_active is the slowest test because we
wait for the instance to be ready, which times out due to a previous
snapshot action. When trying to snapshot an instance, cancel the
operation at the end of the test as part of cleanup.

Change-Id: Ib3821fd288d21e912a8320392425f063b718abbd
'}]
commit_message:
Make negative snapshot tests faster

test_delete_image_that_is_not_yet_active is the slowest test because we
wait for the instance to be ready, which times out due to a previous
snapshot action. When trying to snapshot an instance, cancel the
operation at the end of the test as part of cleanup.

Change-Id: Ib3821fd288d21e912a8320392425f063b718abbd

commit_message:
Suppress the error message in cleanup-env

"default" pool may not exist before cleaning. Suppress the possible
error message:
error: failed to get pool 'default'
error: Storage pool not found: no storage pool with matching name 'default'

Change-Id: I80b4e3732888c7ebadd03b7792a83dd2a6c411d5
Close-Bug: #1261257

commit_message:
Make Neutron API name consistent

Previously several types of name are used for same type operations
in Neutron releated API method names.

* XXXX_modify -> XXXX_update
* <plural>_get -> <singular>_list
* <plural>_list -> <singular>_list

Closes-Bug: #1261283
Change-Id: I95c268822d1a55ea0440b44ea2c7993979ee4c36

commit_message:
Updates tox.ini to use new features

tox 1.6 allows us to skip the sdist step, which
is slow. This does that.
It also allows us to override the install line.
In this case, it's important as it allows us to
stop getting pre-release software we were not
asking for.

Original patch by Monty Taylor, talked about here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/015495.html

Change-Id: Id751f7d5d40a80d348a5f5936539d9462b40b14b

revisions:
[{'number': 24, 'created': '2013-12-15 15:35:36.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/manager.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_network_basic_ops.py', 'tempest/api/network/common.py'], 'message': "scenario/network_basic_ops: detach floating-ip

test that a floating ip is successfuly disassociated from VM's port and
VM becomes unreachable

helper:
api/network/common.py
    override update() method for DeletableFloatingIp - handels
    neutron-update and updates self with result

manager:
    _disassociate_floating_ip(self, floating_ip) - use
    DeletableFloatingIp.update()
    _check_vm_connectivity(should_connect=True)
        add negative connectivity test option - will check ping
        only

Change-Id: Iab5f89d92bc2c4ebb9baff2dee4cade0a4cb07d6
"}]
commit_message:
scenario/network_basic_ops: detach floating-ip

test that a floating ip is successfuly disassociated from VM's port and
VM becomes unreachable

helper:
api/network/common.py
    override update() method for DeletableFloatingIp - handels
    neutron-update and updates self with result

manager:
    _disassociate_floating_ip(self, floating_ip) - use
    DeletableFloatingIp.update()
    _check_vm_connectivity(should_connect=True)
        add negative connectivity test option - will check ping
        only

Change-Id: Iab5f89d92bc2c4ebb9baff2dee4cade0a4cb07d6

subject: Updated: About OpenStack Object Storage Document
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-15 23:39:36.000000000', 'files': ['doc/common/ch_getstart.xml', 'doc/common/section_keystone-concepts.xml', 'doc/admin-guide-cloud/ch_objectstorage.xml', 'doc/common/section_about-object-storage.xml', 'doc/common/app_support.xml'], 'message': "Updated: About OpenStack Object Storage Document

One of the TODO entries was to provide a more comprehensive overview
of Object Storage/Swift than was already written. This is a first
attempt at making it better.

This patch also uncomments a line within the 'admin-guide-cloud' book
that doesn't reference the common 'about-object-storage' page like others
do. I've reverted this and tested thoroughly, not sure why this was there.

In addition, I updated a few other pages where they lacked certain
clarity. For example- the 'Getting Started' page provided only a very
basic overview of the components and without going into too much detail
I added further information. There were also a few English syntax changes
throughout some of the other pages.

Change-Id: I1952d9e1882fc962320304759110a2ccbc50de82
backport: havana
(cherry picked from commit c5aaf5424cec06f83c2dcf4730f3042ec4ea73a4)
"}]
commit_message:
Updated: About OpenStack Object Storage Document

One of the TODO entries was to provide a more comprehensive overview
of Object Storage/Swift than was already written. This is a first
attempt at making it better.

This patch also uncomments a line within the 'admin-guide-cloud' book
that doesn't reference the common 'about-object-storage' page like others
do. I've reverted this and tested thoroughly, not sure why this was there.

In addition, I updated a few other pages where they lacked certain
clarity. For example- the 'Getting Started' page provided only a very
basic overview of the components and without going into too much detail
I added further information. There were also a few English syntax changes
throughout some of the other pages.

Change-Id: I1952d9e1882fc962320304759110a2ccbc50de82
backport: havana
(cherry picked from commit c5aaf5424cec06f83c2dcf4730f3042ec4ea73a4)

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-12-15 03:33:24.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/server.py', 'test/functionalnosetests/test_object.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py'], 'message': "Handle non-integer values for if-delete-at

If a client passes us a non-integer value for if-delete-at we'll now
properly report a 400 error instead of a 503.

Change-Id: I8bb0bb9aa158d415d4f491b5802048f0cd4d8ef6
"}]
commit_message:
Handle non-integer values for if-delete-at

If a client passes us a non-integer value for if-delete-at we'll now
properly report a 400 error instead of a 503.

Closes-Bug: 1259300
Change-Id: I8bb0bb9aa158d415d4f491b5802048f0cd4d8ef6

commit_message:
Revert "Store DIB_* only env variables"

This reverts commit 7c2d1b2295fb2f6f92896795e36f8f49e6f7d55a

We want to capture aggressively to aid reproducability and diagnosing
issues. Environment variables are not suitable storage for
credentials, it's not up to us to police that.

Change-Id: Id8c5ec589e90bfcc361590bb3ffc76a78767ae02

subject: Port deprecate decorator from keystone
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-03 07:06:39.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/utils.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/test_utils.py'], 'message': "Port deprecate decorator from keystone

This should go into OSLO as soon as possible.

There are a few small changes required for keystoneclient.
- There is no gettext interpreting on the client side.
- We don't have OSLO logging, so log directly to warn.
- Add the missing 'HAVANA' deprecation target.
- A few small test fixes

Change-Id: I187c1f499ad6079b2929deae38a005273e33bfc4
"}]
commit_message:
Port deprecate decorator from keystone

This should go into OSLO as soon as possible.

There are a few small changes required for keystoneclient.
- There is no gettext interpreting on the client side.
- We don't have OSLO logging, so log directly to warn.
- Add the missing 'HAVANA' deprecation target.
- A few small test fixes

Change-Id: I187c1f499ad6079b2929deae38a005273e33bfc4

commit_message:
Makes the Swift middleware tests optional

On a given Swift cluster, there's no guarantee that any middleware
will be enabled. Instead of failing this tests should be skipped.
This patch adds an entry to the tempest.conf file for each middlware
describing whether it's enabled or not.

Change-Id: I16c83c12feee588afc58b95e54bf2743c5136021

subject: Tighten ERROR regexp in log checker
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-11 19:01:54.000000000', 'files': ['tools/check_logs.py'], 'message': 'Tighten ERROR regexp in log checker

Because each project uses a slightly different format for logging, and
sometimes different formats within a project, it is hard to match ERROR as
the log level across all log files. There was a failure caused by "ERROR"
actually showing up inside a keystone token. This change will prevent that
though it is still possible something else could slip through.

Change-Id: Ic8b036b4ed7481856231b2d073d273b1df783415
'}]
commit_message:
Tighten ERROR regexp in log checker

Because each project uses a slightly different format for logging, and
sometimes different formats within a project, it is hard to match ERROR as
the log level across all log files. There was a failure caused by "ERROR"
actually showing up inside a keystone token. This change will prevent that
though it is still possible something else could slip through.

Change-Id: Ic8b036b4ed7481856231b2d073d273b1df783415

commit_message:
Remove unused dumps validation in JsonParam value

If the passed parameter is not a valid Json object, a ValueError
exception will be raised in JsonParam parse(). So no need this dumps
validation in value().

Change-Id: Ie450d3923a905b7de3dcbece351aec937ebe7a61

commit_message:
Allow docker plugin to run w/o deps

The docker plugin tests would not run without the docker lib being
installed even though the client was mocked in the tests. This
patch adds conditional import of the client and registration of
the plugin so that the contrib tests can be run in the gates
without having to hack requirements or add more third party
libs.

Change-Id: Ia114f8ebc0cf0b72af8e6e5d2c3264fb7952d7f9
Partial-Bug: #1251380

commit_message:
Don't enable services in os-svc-install

Now that we call os-svc-enable in the individual elements we
can drop the call here.

With this commit *most* services will no longer autostart on first boot
and will rely on post-configuration scripts in os-refresh-config
to enable services. This should clean up our first boot logs
quite a bit...

Change-Id: Ied3622a5e7fce4c3ac2fbd9a0e513ae877cafc5d

commit_message:
Enable some services after installing daemon's...

Update geard and nova-kvm to call os-svc-enable.

Now that we are decoupling service installation and
enabling we need to call os-svc-enable here at install
time.

Should either of these services begin to make use of
os-refresh-config's post install support we should move
the os-svc-enable calls there instead.

Change-Id: I79ee4b2405f81457497ad2591d1bdacda610a426

commit_message:
Call os-svc-enable in post-configure.d

Updates services which make use of os-refresh-config
post configuration to call os-svc-enable to enable
services to start on boot (after configuration).

Making this call here will allow us to avoid pre-enabling
services during installation and get rid of a bunch of
log ERRORs for various OpenStack services.

Change-Id: I32bf9d91723998d200806fda60b9b44fdfe0eb70

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-12-12 15:28:00.000000000', 'files': ['elements/os-svc-install/README.md', 'elements/os-svc-install/bin/os-svc-daemon', 'elements/os-svc-install/install.d/04-os-svc-install', 'elements/os-svc-install/bin/os-svc-enable'], 'message': 'Enable services with os-svc-enable

Split out the code which enables services to start on boot into
a new os-svc-enable script. This script is currently called by
os-svc-deamon so that services automatically start on first boot
(as is the case with os-svc-install)

The motivation here is to decouple service installation and enabling
so that we can eventually avoid starting services on first boot
until after they are configured. Auto starting services on boot like
we currently do is causing lots of log ERROR messages, etc.

Change-Id: I66d4660c169f5918e924eab1876134891c3a24a1
'}]
commit_message:
Enable services with os-svc-enable

Split out the code which enables services to start on boot into
a new os-svc-enable script. This script is currently called by
os-svc-deamon so that services automatically start on first boot
(as is the case with os-svc-install)

The motivation here is to decouple service installation and enabling
so that we can eventually avoid starting services on first boot
until after they are configured. Auto starting services on boot like
we currently do is causing lots of log ERROR messages, etc.

Change-Id: I66d4660c169f5918e924eab1876134891c3a24a1

commit_message:
Add a service enable/disable mechanism for upstart

Upstart doesn't have its own service enable/disable mechanism. We are in
need of a facility to enable/disable services without writing to /etc at
runtime to enable a readonly root for image based updates. This command
will be used by later changes to have a generic service enable/disable
mechanism for all init systems.

Change-Id: I931281988aa746f93de190794f68f4c9e628db19

commit_message:
Switch to using spawn to properly treat errors during sync_state

Changes f1b9ac5a and 9f6ff7e3 were aimed at improving the robustness
of the sync_state method. However both missed switching from spawn_n
to spawn to properly deal with raised exceptions.

Change-Id: Ieda4a5ecca63de67d8a9757962e7e3383fd9c9ea
Related-bug: #1257514

subject: Update tox.ini to use new features
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-09 12:57:35.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Update tox.ini to use new features

tox 1.6 allows us to skip the sdist step, which is slow. This does that.
It also allows us to override the install line. In this case, it's
important as it allows us to stop getting pre-release software we
weren't asking for.

Original patch by Monty Taylor, talked about here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/015495.html

Change-Id: I9fe8a6cff149b3b79d434dc955c77a358c43031d
"}]
commit_message:
Update tox.ini to use new features

tox 1.6 allows us to skip the sdist step, which is slow. This does that.
It also allows us to override the install line. In this case, it's
important as it allows us to stop getting pre-release software we
weren't asking for.

Original patch by Monty Taylor, talked about here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/015495.html

Change-Id: I9fe8a6cff149b3b79d434dc955c77a358c43031d

Property 'network' is added to networks schema of the resource
os::nova::Server. It takes uuid or name. The 'uuid' property is deprecated.

commit_message:
Command call should log the stdout and stderr

Our utils.execute method did not log the stdout and stderr message
for command call, for these message, they are required for us to
track command call stdout and std error in details.

Change-Id: Ibfb15c3a004f1c2c091e59f452ebaaceeebd934d
Closes-Bug: #1242544

commit_message:
Updates tox.ini to use new features

Reasons:
 - tox update v1.6

Changes:
 - tox 1.6 allows us to skip the sdist step, which is slow.
 - It also allows us to override the install line. In this case, it's
   important as it allows us to stop getting pre-release software we
   weren't asking for.

Original patch by Monty Taylor, talked about here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/015495.html

Change-Id: Ib51796afbfdffb5a879046ca1b94a55b1f6ef6f1

commit_message:
Neutron expects /etc/neutron/plugin.ini

Neutron expects /etc/neutron/plugin.ini to contain the Neutron plugin
configuration, or to be a symlink to it. The guide incorrectly referred
to /etc/neutron/plugins.ini (not the s).

The typo has been corrected and the explicity ln command to create the
link added.

Change-Id: Ib81b8f18c71cfc9604cf41f37b7be5d221716c9b
Closes-Bug: #1260173
backport: havana

commit_message:
Add command for creating plugins.ini symlink

Neutron expects /etc/neutron/plugins.ini to be the plugin configuration
file or, more commonly, a symlink to the plugin configuration file.

Change-Id: I172e782ba609f7f2250b5ae56d0fee1fe562165b
Closes-Bug: #1260173

commit_message:
Use ScaledResource as type for InstanceGroup members

Use the placeholder type OS::Heat::ScaledResource as the nominal resource
type for resources in an instance group. Use the environment to select the
actual underlying resource type (current AWS::EC2::Instance).

Change-Id: I52252c596fa48e57d927eb78e9d5b7c8261adb3e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-15 22:41:51.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_end.sh', 'scripts/devtest_seed.sh', 'scripts/devtest_undercloud.sh', 'scripts/devtest_overcloud.sh', 'scripts/devtest.sh'], 'message': 'Set pipefail on all devtest scripts

We are missing failures of any commands which pipe their output to
another command. That is particularly troubling as, for instance, we
were recently missing the fact that the overcloud-control image was

Change-Id: Ied3e9a6821d6c19d7e9e82f90a461b62c7b14ddf

commit_message:
Set pipefail on all devtest scripts

We are missing failures of any commands which pipe their output to
another command. That is particularly troubling as, for instance, we
were recently missing the fact that the overcloud-control image was
failing to build.

Change-Id: Ied3e9a6821d6c19d7e9e82f90a461b62c7b14ddf

commit_message:
Add node-validate to cli

Add the node-validate command that triggers the validation of the 'core'
and 'standardized' driver interfaces of a given node. This will also be
used by the ironic driver on nova to validate the node driver interfaces
before deploying it.

Change-Id: I93811c9bfbfe4f7b8559fc4ce566c8d4e19a54ac

commit_message:
Nicira: Fix core_plugin path and update default values in README

The following patch fixes the core_plugin path in the README file
which broke during the rename of quantum to neutron here ee3fe4e8.
This patch also updates a few of the default values and removes
the promise of adding support for multiple control clusters.

Issue reported by: Ben Lin <blin@nicira.com>

Change-Id: Ia46d80384efaa220685f98afa591177d00021362
Closes-bug: #1260550

subject: Allow heat tests to use already uploaded test image
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-12-11 21:37:17.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest'], 'message': 'Allow heat tests to use already uploaded test image

If $HEAT_FETCHED_TEST_IMAGE is set then tempest is configured to
use the image named $HEAT_FETCHED_TEST_IMAGE for any orchestration
tests which require an image.

Fallback to checking $HEAT_CREATE_TEST_IMAGE and invoking
diskimage-builder if necessary.

The intent is to use Fedora 20 as the test image for gating
since this image has heat-cfntools already installed.

Change-Id: I177ae091a641ba99fd4c618e30a39c5148ae617f
'}]
commit_message:
Allow heat tests to use already uploaded test image

If $HEAT_FETCHED_TEST_IMAGE is set then tempest is configured to
use the image named $HEAT_FETCHED_TEST_IMAGE for any orchestration
tests which require an image.

Fallback to checking $HEAT_CREATE_TEST_IMAGE and invoking
diskimage-builder if necessary.

The intent is to use Fedora 20 as the test image for gating
since this image has heat-cfntools already installed.

Change-Id: I177ae091a641ba99fd4c618e30a39c5148ae617f

commit_message:
RBD clone from image requires disk_format raw

When creating an rbd volume from image, each driver is now
provided with the image disk_format. The RBD driver will refuse
to do a clone if the image is not of disk_format 'raw' which will
result in the image being converted to raw prior to creating the
volume.

Also converted corresponding unit test to use mock (instead
of mox).

Change-Id: I3fab61196039dc2cc34edef75d5f00989634a99a
Closes-bug: 1247998

This will also speed up search since encoding is moved out of the
the loop. Also, getting all security groups is done only once.
The code to check if multiple matches are found is dead since
nova does not allow creating multiple security groups with same name
Thus there is no need to write another test to check NoUniqueMatch

Closes-Bug: #1254945

commit_message:
Simplify security group search logic

This will also speed up search since encoding is moved out of the
the loop. Also, getting all security groups is done only once.
The code to check if multiple matches are found is dead since
nova does not allow creating multiple security groups with same name
Thus there is no need to write another test to check NoUniqueMatch
exception.

Change-Id: I3091ebf87923ca2e6e97e409dc9c2d95f8854af7
Closes-Bug: #1254945

subject: NVP plugin: Do backend router delete out from db transaction
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-13 12:05:15.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/nicira/NeutronPlugin.py'], 'message': 'NVP plugin: Do backend router delete out from db transaction

Performing the NVP API operation from within a DB transaction
increases the risk of a deadlock between sqlalchemy and eventlet.

With this patch, the operation is moved outside of the db transaction
and appropriate mechanism are put in place for:
i) ensuring neutron db consistency in case of NVP failures
ii) avoiding deleting from backend if neutron logic does not allow it

This patch also synchronizes the routine for removing a router
gateway port from NVP.

Change-Id: I58d156e303e7a56ceb8c62766c192e154b0a3bb4
Closes-Bug: #1258150
'}]
commit_message:
NVP plugin: Do backend router delete out from db transaction

Performing the NVP API operation from within a DB transaction
increases the risk of a deadlock between sqlalchemy and eventlet.

With this patch, the operation is moved outside of the db transaction
and appropriate mechanism are put in place for:
i) ensuring neutron db consistency in case of NVP failures
ii) avoiding deleting from backend if neutron logic does not allow it

This patch also synchronizes the routine for removing a router
gateway port from NVP.

Change-Id: I58d156e303e7a56ceb8c62766c192e154b0a3bb4
Closes-Bug: #1258150

commit_message:
Cleanup backend loading

Backend creation was happening at import time. This changes the
code so that backend creation time is controlled by calling a
function.

This also allows sharing the backend creation code between the
server and the tests.

Change-Id: Ib817aa341de510a46faa8ed0bc24ef9268fa944b

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-02 17:05:41.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/glusterfs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_glusterfs.py'], 'message': "GlusterFS: Complete snapshot_delete when info doesn't exist

The snapshot_delete operation will fail if the snapshot info file
doesn't contain a record for the snapshot, or does not exist.
This happens in cases such as when snapshot_create fails to commit
anything to disk.

The driver should allow the manager to delete the snapshot
in this case, as there is no action required for the driver
to delete anything.

Closes-Bug: #1252864

Change-Id: I8686a1be09dbb7984072538bff6c026bb84eeb52
"}]
commit_message:
GlusterFS: Complete snapshot_delete when info doesn't exist

The snapshot_delete operation will fail if the snapshot info file
doesn't contain a record for the snapshot, or does not exist.
This happens in cases such as when snapshot_create fails to commit
anything to disk.

The driver should allow the manager to delete the snapshot
in this case, as there is no action required for the driver
to delete anything.

Closes-Bug: #1252864

Change-Id: I8686a1be09dbb7984072538bff6c026bb84eeb52

subject: WIP: Add ECU setting for libvirt
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-06 08:18:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'etc/nova/nova.conf.sample'], 'message': 'WIP: Add ECU setting for libvirt

ECU(Elastic Compute Unit) is for implementing the similar virtual
machine performance on several heterogeneous nova-compute servers.

There is the way to configure cpu_quota and cpu_period with flavor
extra_spec already. However, that way can not implement the similar
virtual machine performance on different performance servers.
We need the different ratio of cpu_quota and cpu_period for each
server performance for adjusting the virtual machine performance,
but the extra_spec of a flavor contains the same ratio of cpu_quota
and cpu_period.

This patch adds some configuration items for adjusting cpu_quota and
cpu_period on each nova-compute server.

Related to blueprint nova-ecu-support

Change-Id: I8835fa03d16792dfbec9a9f36f5171c8ea1e3e53
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Add ECU setting for libvirt

ECU(Elastic Compute Unit) is for implementing the similar virtual
machine performance on several heterogeneous nova-compute servers.

There is the way to configure cpu_quota and cpu_period with flavor
extra_spec already. However, that way can not implement the similar
virtual machine performance on different performance servers.
We need the different ratio of cpu_quota and cpu_period for each
server performance for adjusting the virtual machine performance,
but the extra_spec of a flavor contains the same ratio of cpu_quota
and cpu_period.

This patch adds some configuration items for adjusting cpu_quota and
cpu_period on each nova-compute server.

Related to blueprint nova-ecu-support

Change-Id: I8835fa03d16792dfbec9a9f36f5171c8ea1e3e53

commit_message:
Refactor setup_logging

This change just cleans up the setup_logging function. It was
defined in keystone.common.config and then also exported from
keystone.config. Also, it had extra parameters that were unused.

This takes care of a NOTE (which probably should have been a
TODO) in the code.

commit_message:
Change Port create API to EAFP

Port creation in API is LBYL, but should be EAFP, we have
UniqueConstraint on address column, just catch the exception and
handle to show client a useful information.

Change-Id: I6846e440c38543d4f4f19dae44d774df2e04107e
Closes-Bug: #1244348

subject: Get test_openAuth_can_refuse_None_uri to cleanup after itself
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-08 13:35:32.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_fakelibvirt.py'], 'message': 'Get test_openAuth_can_refuse_None_uri to cleanup after itself

test_openAuth_can_refuse_None_uri sets the global
libvirt.allow_default_uri_connection to False but it leaves
it in this state which could cause test_tpool_execute_calls_libvirt
to fail if it ran immediately afterwards. This patch adds a cleanup
so _reset is called at the end of the test and not just if
another test in the same class is run after it.

Change-Id: I9762fcb81b2318beeb056c67bd9172056e1449ab
Closes-Bug: 1258553
'}]
commit_message:
Get test_openAuth_can_refuse_None_uri to cleanup after itself

test_openAuth_can_refuse_None_uri sets the global
libvirt.allow_default_uri_connection to False but it leaves
it in this state which could cause test_tpool_execute_calls_libvirt
to fail if it ran immediately afterwards. This patch adds a cleanup
so _reset is called at the end of the test and not just if
another test in the same class is run after it.

Change-Id: I9762fcb81b2318beeb056c67bd9172056e1449ab
Closes-Bug: 1258553

commit_message:
Allow configuring the wsgi pool size

Expose the number of greenthreads in wsgi pool to configuration. This
allows to put a limit to the number of resources like memcache
connections used.

DocImpact

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2013-12-12 14:55:40.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/test_utils.py', 'keystone/common/utils.py', 'keystone/tests/test_backend.py'], 'message': "Create user returns 400 without a password

If it is intended to create a new user without password (is optional)
keystone user-create --name <name>
keystone fails returning error 400.

The change consist in checking if the request has password: None
don't make the password hash

Co-Authored-By: huangtianhua<huangtianhua@huawei.com>
Closes-Bug: #1245342
Change-Id: If6f5789dcec0610a237f286d0d17ad4b100ef5f3

commit_message:
Create user returns 400 without a password

If it is intended to create a new user without password (is optional)
keystone user-create --name <name>
keystone fails returning error 400.

The change consist in checking if the request has password: None
don't make the password hash

Co-Authored-By: huangtianhua<huangtianhua@huawei.com>
Closes-Bug: #1245342
Change-Id: If6f5789dcec0610a237f286d0d17ad4b100ef5f3

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2013-12-11 04:34:11.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Updates tox.ini to use new features

tox 1.6 allows us to skip the sdist step, which is slow. This does that.
It also allows us to override the install line. In this case, it's
important as it allows us to stop getting pre-release software we
weren't asking for.

Original patch by Monty Taylor, talked about here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/015495.html

Change-Id: I2042cae5ebf5467408fe6cdb71f6147081b72ca6
"}]
commit_message:
Updates tox.ini to use new features

tox 1.6 allows us to skip the sdist step, which is slow. This does that.
It also allows us to override the install line. In this case, it's
important as it allows us to stop getting pre-release software we
weren't asking for.

Original patch by Monty Taylor, talked about here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/015495.html

Change-Id: I2042cae5ebf5467408fe6cdb71f6147081b72ca6

commit_message:
Deny API requests where context doesn't match path

We shouldn't overwrite the context tenant_id (which comes from the
scope of the auth_token) with that from the path, instead raise a
HTTPForbidden exception if the path-provided tenant_id doesn't match
the context.

Change-Id: Ib6fb9881103312f7492081a20178f12309f35d81
Closes-Bug: #1256983

commit_message:
Bad workflow-steps check: has_required_fields

Many of the tabs on the Instance Creation screen don't show a "*"
despite having require fields.  This is due to faulty logic in determining
whether the workflow-step has require fields.  (Previously, only keys from
the contributes list were checked.)

Change-Id: Id609da27c51f8d4725683d7fd1534ead0c3bb984
Closes-Bug: 1252005

subject: Updated: About OpenStack Object Storage Document
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-14 13:13:02.000000000', 'files': ['doc/common/ch_getstart.xml', 'doc/common/section_keystone-concepts.xml', 'doc/admin-guide-cloud/ch_objectstorage.xml', 'doc/common/section_about-object-storage.xml', 'doc/common/app_support.xml'], 'message': "Updated: About OpenStack Object Storage Document

One of the TODO entries was to provide a more comprehensive overview
of Object Storage/Swift than was already written. This is a first
attempt at making it better.

This patch also uncomments a line within the 'admin-guide-cloud' book
that doesn't reference the common 'about-object-storage' page like others
do. I've reverted this and tested thoroughly, not sure why this was there.

In addition, I updated a few other pages where they lacked certain
clarity. For example- the 'Getting Started' page provided only a very
basic overview of the components and without going into too much detail
I added further information. There were also a few English syntax changes
throughout some of the other pages.

Change-Id: I1952d9e1882fc962320304759110a2ccbc50de82
backport: havana
"}]
commit_message:
Updated: About OpenStack Object Storage Document

One of the TODO entries was to provide a more comprehensive overview
of Object Storage/Swift than was already written. This is a first
attempt at making it better.

This patch also uncomments a line within the 'admin-guide-cloud' book
that doesn't reference the common 'about-object-storage' page like others
do. I've reverted this and tested thoroughly, not sure why this was there.

In addition, I updated a few other pages where they lacked certain
clarity. For example- the 'Getting Started' page provided only a very
basic overview of the components and without going into too much detail
I added further information. There were also a few English syntax changes
throughout some of the other pages.

Change-Id: I1952d9e1882fc962320304759110a2ccbc50de82
backport: havana

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2013-12-14 03:40:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/network/neutronv2/api.py'], 'message': 'Remove unneeded call to conductor in network interface

The following patch removes an unneeded call to conductor to retrieve
data already available in instance.

Note: six.text_type() was added and wrapped around info_cache in some of
the tests. This was done because values from the db are in unicode
(text_type). The reason the test changed is because previously we
did not check the type of string from what the conductor was returning.

Change-Id: I45a24af11534911be68fd0964b79fdf726d88de6
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unneeded call to conductor in network interface

The following patch removes an unneeded call to conductor to retrieve
data already available in instance.

Note: six.text_type() was added and wrapped around info_cache in some of
the tests. This was done because values from the db are in unicode
(text_type). The reason the test changed is because previously we
did not check the type of string from what the conductor was returning.

Closes-bug: #1258360

Change-Id: I45a24af11534911be68fd0964b79fdf726d88de6

commit_message:
Make live migrations work for non volume-backed instances with RBD

* Add a new ceph user and pool for ephemeral storage
* Update nova configuration to store ephemeral volumes in RBD pool
* Open libvirt ports requred for live migration
* Restrict VNC traffic to management network

Change-Id: I772c6d94de4537ad82d4b62822bdc4f702e8ff56
Implements: blueprint ceph-live-migration

subject: Add IPAddress field type in object models
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-12-12 10:13:43.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/objects/test_fields.py', 'nova/objects/fields.py'], 'message': 'Add IPAddress field type in object models

In object models, there are ipv4 address type and ipv6 address type.
However, for some fields in models.py, for instance, host_ip in compute node,
and a bunch of IPAddress variables in network, and address in other tables.

There is no field type corresponding to them, no matter whether it is v4 or
v6. So, add one more field type in object models to specify that type.

Change-Id: Ic53ed644f4bbc1e280b2f8cbb9b9c145c3d8a2e9
'}]
commit_message:
Add IPAddress field type in object models

In object models, there are ipv4 address type and ipv6 address type.
However, for some fields in models.py, for instance, host_ip in compute node,
and a bunch of IPAddress variables in network, and address in other tables.

There is no field type corresponding to them, no matter whether it is v4 or
v6. So, add one more field type in object models to specify that type.

Change-Id: Ic53ed644f4bbc1e280b2f8cbb9b9c145c3d8a2e9

subject: Add a control point for floating IP assignment
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-13 18:52:15.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/manager.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_network_basic_ops.py'], 'message': "Add a control point for floating IP assignment

In the basic network scenario test, the test for accessiblity via the
floating IP stands a very good chance of failing because the attempt to
connect begins before the system has had a chance to associate the
floating IP address.  While an extended delay does signify a performance
issue for those types of operations, the timing of the test can be
adversly affected by other factors (e.g. parallel tests, loaded test
  system). If it is extreme the check for the IP address will fail the
test as well. This addition also covers a loophole in the test where
the connectivity would work but the metadata that is provided through
the client call is not updated properly.

An additional small fix in manager.py resolves an issue when a client
API uses mixed or lower case for status strings (e.g. cinder).

There isn't a specific bug that this modification addresses.

Change-Id: Ifb1889f67588e6ee4d19f592da61ab574d456be2
"}]
commit_message:
Add a control point for floating IP assignment

In the basic network scenario test, the test for accessiblity via the
floating IP stands a very good chance of failing because the attempt to
connect begins before the system has had a chance to associate the
floating IP address.  While an extended delay does signify a performance
issue for those types of operations, the timing of the test can be
adversly affected by other factors (e.g. parallel tests, loaded test
  system). If it is extreme the check for the IP address will fail the
test as well. This addition also covers a loophole in the test where
the connectivity would work but the metadata that is provided through
the client call is not updated properly.

An additional small fix in manager.py resolves an issue when a client
API uses mixed or lower case for status strings (e.g. cinder).

There isn't a specific bug that this modification addresses.

Change-Id: Ifb1889f67588e6ee4d19f592da61ab574d456be2

subject: Add whitelist entry for s-proxy 'Timeout talking to memcached'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-14 02:31:57.000000000', 'files': ['etc/whitelist.yaml'], 'message': 'Add whitelist entry for s-proxy 'Timeout talking to memcached'

According to John Dickinson:

"This isn't an error. It's logged at an error level because it may hint
at other problems, and it's something an operator needs to know about,
but it is not an unhandled failure condition. (Think of it similarly how
in swift a server being down is an "error", but it's something that
swift seamlessly works around.)"

Closes-Bug: #1260894

Change-Id: I41e55c5e34ee214727fbbd7b9daa1f6ea9bf8050
'}]
commit_message:
Add whitelist entry for s-proxy 'Timeout talking to memcached'

According to John Dickinson:

"This isn't an error. It's logged at an error level because it may hint
at other problems, and it's something an operator needs to know about,
but it is not an unhandled failure condition. (Think of it similarly how
in swift a server being down is an "error", but it's something that
swift seamlessly works around.)"

Closes-Bug: #1260894

Change-Id: I41e55c5e34ee214727fbbd7b9daa1f6ea9bf8050

subject: Set pipefail for wrapper scripts
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-12-14 15:42:30.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/tests/test_wrappers.py', 'tox.ini', 'tools/pretty_tox.sh', 'tools/pretty_tox_serial.sh'], 'message': 'Set pipefail for wrapper scripts

Previously if the testr list command was failing subunit2py would
return a 0 making the test runs that use the pretty_tox scripts also
return 0 despite testr actually failing. This commit gets around this
condition by setting pipefail in the pretty_tox scripts to ensure that
we actually fail.

Change-Id: I9cbaf83cfea7c02133b27fe639e7ea12edb48f7e
'}]
commit_message:
Set pipefail for wrapper scripts

Previously if the testr list command was failing subunit2py would
return a 0 making the test runs that use the pretty_tox scripts also
return 0 despite testr actually failing. This commit gets around this
condition by setting pipefail in the pretty_tox scripts to ensure that
we actually fail.

Change-Id: I9cbaf83cfea7c02133b27fe639e7ea12edb48f7e

http://openstack.markmail.org/thread/zi7bkeqlnjbtkz5t

commit_message:
Pass Instance object to console output virt driver api

Update the get_console_output() method of the virt driver API to be
defined to accept an Instance object.  While we're at it, pass the
context, as well.

Change-Id: If325a39f6314cff936e604fcc5816deefbb1199b

[{'number': 11, 'created': '2013-12-12 23:16:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_rpcapi.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/compute/rpcapi.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': 'Send Instance object to validate_console_port

Update the validate_console_port() method of the compute rpc api to take
in an Instance object instead of a dict.  The object_compat() decorator
is used to ensure the change is backwards compatible, and that the code
will still work if it receives an instance in dict format.

Change-Id: Ief8fabc8490315acb41bf85ad421683fea31daf9
'}]
commit_message:
Send Instance object to validate_console_port

Update the validate_console_port() method of the compute rpc api to take
in an Instance object instead of a dict.  The object_compat() decorator
is used to ensure the change is backwards compatible, and that the code
will still work if it receives an instance in dict format.

Change-Id: Ief8fabc8490315acb41bf85ad421683fea31daf9

nova.tests.test_utils and nova.tests.utils along with any impacted tests
using the changed parts.

Part of blueprint flavor-instance-type-dedup

commit_message:
Fix typos in documents

Fix typos detected by toolkit misspellings.

 * pip install misspellings
 * git ls-files | grep -v locale | misspellings -f -

Closes-Bug: #1257295
Change-Id: Ibb5917ab5af541a381630bd013b05d22badd4364

commit_message:
rename get_pid_file to ensure_get_pid_file

Function of get_pid_file doesn't simply do the readonly operation of
obtaining pid_file. Change the function name to better describe its
purpose

commit_message:
Fix and enable gating on H702

Formatting operations should be outside of localization,
otherwise translation lookup will never find a translated
string as a match. This also fixes H701 alongway.

Change-Id: I6708e0f5b11841b18ba9042ac4958643f91396dd

Add disabled_reason field to services table

Add a column (String 255) in the services table to store
disabled_reason field.

Implements part of bp record-reason-for-disabling-service

subject: Handle the case of pipe char in value for iniset
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-12-12 12:26:17.000000000', 'files': ['functions', 'tests/test_ini.sh'], 'message': 'Handle the case of pipe char in value for iniset

iniset did not handle the case of "|" in the value
to be injected. Fix this by replacing | with \000 (NULL).

Fixes bug #1258050

Change-Id: I8882c2f3f177ebdfa0c66270dbbc7fd50f30b065
'}]
commit_message:
Handle the case of pipe char in value for iniset

iniset did not handle the case of "|" in the value
to be injected. Fix this by replacing | with \000 (NULL).

Fixes bug #1258050

Change-Id: I8882c2f3f177ebdfa0c66270dbbc7fd50f30b065

commit_message:
remove a spurious wait that could get us into trouble

it's not really clear that this wait is useful for anything
except generating bugs when we've done terible things to the
image during this test. Removing it as unneeded.

Change-Id: I88546bf3845d8e62d4baf5572f0403c0eaa983ba
Closes-Bug: #1229890

commit_message:
Pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: I0487b4eca8f2755b882689289e3cdf429729b1fb

subject: Prevent spoofing instance_id from neutron to nova
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-11 20:39:22.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/metadata/handler.py', 'nova/tests/test_metadata.py'], 'message': "Prevent spoofing instance_id from neutron to nova

Previously, one could update a port's device_id in neutron to be
that of another tenant's instance_id and then be able to retrieve
that instance's metadata. This patch prevents this from occurring by
checking that X-Tenant-ID received from the metadata request matches
the tenant_id in the nova database.

DocImpact - This patch is dependent on another patch in neutron
            which adds X-Tenant-ID to the request. Therefore to
            minimize downtime one should upgrade Neutron first (then
            restart neutron-metadata-agent) and lastly update nova.

Change-Id: I93bf662797c3986324ca2099b403833c2e990fb4
Closes-Bug: #1235450
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent spoofing instance_id from neutron to nova

Previously, one could update a port's device_id in neutron to be
that of another tenant's instance_id and then be able to retrieve
that instance's metadata. This patch prevents this from occurring by
checking that X-Tenant-ID received from the metadata request matches
the tenant_id in the nova database.

DocImpact - This patch is dependent on another patch in neutron
            which adds X-Tenant-ID to the request. Therefore to
            minimize downtime one should upgrade Neutron first (then
            restart neutron-metadata-agent) and lastly update nova.

Change-Id: I93bf662797c3986324ca2099b403833c2e990fb4
Closes-Bug: #1235450

enforcing the policy, so add calls to _enforce which fixes that,

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 330, 'name': 'John Dickinson', 'email': 'me@not.mn', 'username': 'notmyname'}, {'_account_id': 866, 'name': 'Chmouel Boudjnah', 'email': 'chmouel@chmouel.com', 'username': 'chmouel'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 5619, 'name': 'Koert van der Veer', 'email': 'koert@cloudvps.com', 'username': 'kvdveer'}, {'_account_id': 6550, 'name': 'Davide Guerri', 'email': 'davide.guerri@gmail.com', 'username': 'davide-guerri'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-10 12:12:59.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_utils.py', 'swiftclient/utils.py', 'swiftclient/client.py'], 'message': "Enable usage of proxies defined in environment (http(s)_proxy).

As far as proxies usage is concerned, keystone-client API and swift-client API behave differently because the former uses python Request library while the latter uses raw httplib. As a result, Keystone authentication honors environment variables http_proxy, https_proxy and no_proxy while Swift doesn't.

This patch, which code is mainly borrowed from Python Requests, makes Swift
data connections and Swift authentication connections behaving homogeneously.

Change-Id: Ic8a0089c35c458d7ed96e572e22429014298fe4c
"}]
commit_message:
Enable usage of proxies defined in environment (http(s)_proxy).

As far as proxies usage is concerned, keystone-client API and swift-client API behave differently because the former uses python Request library while the latter uses raw httplib. As a result, Keystone authentication honors environment variables http_proxy, https_proxy and no_proxy while Swift doesn't.

This patch, which code is mainly borrowed from Python Requests, makes Swift
data connections and Swift authentication connections behaving homogeneously.

Change-Id: Ic8a0089c35c458d7ed96e572e22429014298fe4c

subject: Don't save mysql logs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-12 17:00:27.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh'], 'message': "Don't save mysql logs

Currently a full tempest run produces 600MiB of _compressed_ log data,
of which 324MiB are mysql logs.  This is because devstack configures
the mysql slow query log to log every query.  This seems like an
excessive level of debugging for the gate, so lets not save those
logs.

Change-Id: Ib4cdfc929b93b289916295ff365a46979555a574
"}]
commit_message:
Don't save mysql logs

Currently a full tempest run produces 600MiB of _compressed_ log data,
of which 324MiB are mysql logs.  This is because devstack configures
the mysql slow query log to log every query.  This seems like an
excessive level of debugging for the gate, so lets not save those
logs.

Change-Id: Ib4cdfc929b93b289916295ff365a46979555a574

commit_message:
Pass Instance object to compute vnc rpc api

Pass a real Instance object to the get_vnc_console() method of the
compute rpc api.  The object_compat() decorator is used to provide
backwards compatibility with receiving data in the old format.

Change-Id: Ib615fd653e0ef6196241fde81f541b1e18eb3ced

commit_message:
Destroy docker container if spawn fails to set up network

If docker driver failed to set up network when spawn an instance,
then the docker driver should also destroy the container to make
sure no garbage container left for such case.

Change-Id: Ia1828425d246601b6e1403c59f1768b6ae593afc
Closes-Bug: #1242815

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-12-12 13:29:07.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Updates tox.ini to use new features

tox 1.6 allows us to skip the sdist step, which is slow. This does that.
It also allows us to override the install line. In this case, it's
important as it allows us to stop getting pre-release software we
weren't asking for.

Original patch by Monty Taylor, talked about here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/015495.html

Change-Id: I87f172cfcc44c9afff9c5162791d6c6b31972702

commit_message:
Updates tox.ini to use new features

tox 1.6 allows us to skip the sdist step, which is slow. This does that.
It also allows us to override the install line. In this case, it's
important as it allows us to stop getting pre-release software we
weren't asking for.

Original patch by Monty Taylor, talked about here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/015495.html

Change-Id: I87f172cfcc44c9afff9c5162791d6c6b31972702

subject: HTTPretty: update to 0.7.1
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-13 14:07:07.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'tests/files/gr-base.txt'], 'message': 'HTTPretty: update to 0.7.1

The 0.7.1 release has a fix for the parse_querystring function, which raised a
TypeError on Python 3.3. See:

https://github.com/gabrielfalcao/HTTPretty/commit/5c6e776

This helps fix some tests on Python3.3 in python-keystoneclient.

Change-Id: If14a0afe9d42602e978377d6f6ee830affe0cc41
'}]
commit_message:
HTTPretty: update to 0.7.1

The 0.7.1 release has a fix for the parse_querystring function, which raised a
TypeError on Python 3.3. See:

https://github.com/gabrielfalcao/HTTPretty/commit/5c6e776

This helps fix some tests on Python3.3 in python-keystoneclient.

commit_message:
Don't replace (and log) the same resource entry

Resources may be registered multiple times. This
ensures that logs are only emitted the first time
a resource is registered.

Change-Id: Iedd12d55007ee24ea6ecbe4fe7152ff65ea665b0

subject: Require List objects to be able to backlevel their contents
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1030, 'name': 'Chris Behrens', 'email': 'cbehrens@codestud.com', 'username': 'cbehrens'}, {'_account_id': 1501, 'name': 'Phil Day', 'email': 'philip.day@hp.com', 'username': 'philip-day'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5511, 'name': 'Nikola Dipanov', 'email': 'ndipanov@redhat.com', 'username': 'ndipanov'}, {'_account_id': 7069, 'name': 'Joshua Hesketh', 'email': 'josh@nitrotech.org', 'username': 'jhesketh'}, {'_account_id': 7763, 'name': 'Alexei Kornienko', 'email': 'akornienko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'akornienko'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2013-12-13 19:41:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/base.py', 'nova/objects/service.py', 'nova/tests/objects/test_objects.py', 'nova/objects/instance_fault.py', 'nova/objects/security_group_rule.py', 'nova/objects/keypair.py', 'nova/objects/instance_action.py', 'nova/objects/pci_device.py', 'nova/objects/compute_node.py', 'nova/objects/instance_group.py', 'nova/objects/flavor.py', 'nova/objects/instance.py', 'nova/objects/aggregate.py', 'nova/objects/security_group.py', 'nova/objects/migration.py'], 'message': 'Require List objects to be able to backlevel their contents

Right now, a client declares its supported version of a given object
automatically in the remoted calls it makes to conductor. However,
in the case of things like InstanceList.get_by_foo(), they are
reporting the version of their InstanceList object, not their
Instance object. Conductor fills a version-matching InstanceList
object with brand new Instance objects, which the client, of course,
barfs on.

There may be a better way to handle this going forward, but for now,
stop the bleeding by requiring a version bump to the corresponding
List object whenever the object type it contains takes a version
bump. This adds a test to validate that all the objects registered
have a suitable mapping for the current version in the tree.

Since this actually caused a breakage in the Instance object
recently, this also bumps the InstanceList version so that
conductors running this commit (or later) will properly send
version 1.9 Instance objects to Havana clients and version 1.10+
to newer ones.

Change-Id: I2668dead4784fbd0411d1b6372a9a8006eeb2e84
Related-Bug: #1258256
Closes-Bug: #1254902
'}]
commit_message:
Require List objects to be able to backlevel their contents

Right now, a client declares its supported version of a given object
automatically in the remoted calls it makes to conductor. However,
in the case of things like InstanceList.get_by_foo(), they are
reporting the version of their InstanceList object, not their
Instance object. Conductor fills a version-matching InstanceList
object with brand new Instance objects, which the client, of course,
barfs on.

There may be a better way to handle this going forward, but for now,
stop the bleeding by requiring a version bump to the corresponding
List object whenever the object type it contains takes a version
bump. This adds a test to validate that all the objects registered
have a suitable mapping for the current version in the tree.

Since this actually caused a breakage in the Instance object
recently, this also bumps the InstanceList version so that
conductors running this commit (or later) will properly send
version 1.9 Instance objects to Havana clients and version 1.10+
to newer ones.

Change-Id: I2668dead4784fbd0411d1b6372a9a8006eeb2e84
Related-Bug: #1258256
Closes-Bug: #1254902

For plugins that use dhcp agent the deletion of dhcp ports
is done asynchronously so horizon displays the port after subnet deletion.

'}]
commit_message:
Mark dhcp ports as pending delete on subnet deletion

For plugins that use dhcp agent the deletion of dhcp ports
is done asynchronously so horizon displays the port after subnet deletion.
Need to mark such ports as pending delete to let
horizon filter and not display them

Change-Id: Ib99f07316232094cb344f68f116659c9cb462ca3
Closes-Bug: #1131730

commit_message:
nova tests fail when run in a virtual environment

The virConnect object signature expects Uri and Readonly
parameters that the test is not passing. Fixed the test by
calling the virConnect object with all the required parameters.

Closes-Bug: #1257813
Change-Id: Ib79800a87dd64ba317fe15ee2bf19b696a3765b9

commit_message:
WIP POC of overview page

Just putting things together, to see what we are missing from ceiloemter

- To have reliable history, we are missing support of mongo's 'distinct'.
  It should land at I2 with bp complex-filter-expressions-in-api-queries

Implements bp project-overview-page-ceilometer

Change-Id: I15ae63c4919f9dfbc4d37f746e42088d8f528534

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-06 11:42:41.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/action_engine/decider.py', 'taskflow/storage.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/engine.py', 'taskflow/persistence/logbook.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_storage.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/task_action.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/graph_action.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_progress.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_suspend_flow.py'], 'message': "Do not create TaskAction for each task

Since we have a graph of tasks instead of TaskAction we don't need
to create a TaskAction for each task. This allows us to operate with
tasks directly without mapping on TaskAction.

TaskAction was a holder of task uuid. Task names are unique in the
flow, so I decided to operate with tasks' names instead of uuids in
storage. Task uuid now is only used to store task details.

Benefits of this refactoring: speed and memory optimizations and
code clean-up, user-friendly logs (task_name is printed instead of uuid).

Change-Id: I42235fb393a3a2ee1a25139d6d91602131d12456
"}]
commit_message:
Do not create TaskAction for each task

Since we have a graph of tasks instead of TaskAction we don't need
to create a TaskAction for each task. This allows us to operate with
tasks directly without mapping on TaskAction.

TaskAction was a holder of task uuid. Task names are unique in the
flow, so I decided to operate with tasks' names instead of uuids in
storage. Task uuid now is only used to store task details.

Benefits of this refactoring: speed and memory optimizations and
code clean-up, user-friendly logs (task_name is printed instead of uuid).

Change-Id: I42235fb393a3a2ee1a25139d6d91602131d12456

subject: provide a global default for lock dir
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-12-05 20:46:39.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/lockutils.py', 'tests/unit/test_lockutils.py'], 'message': "provide a global default for lock dir

this is based on one proposed upgrade path for cinder on the
openstack-dev mailing list. Instead of making oslo lockutils error
if the user has not added a config variable for lock path in their
service (which they never needed to do before) use tempdir instead.

in order to address the security concerns of file truncation attacks,
open the files for locking in 'a' mode, which will make them non
destructive to the underlying files. Add tests to ensure that we
don't truncate underlying files.

also throw an error message to the user that this isn't a safe
mode to run in. That will hopefully mean they will only use this
for the small window of rolling their cluster forward, then
configure it to something more sane.

Change-Id: Ia96a8926741464cf0d47d2c25c77b9c746c1b334
"}]
commit_message:
provide a global default for lock dir

this is based on one proposed upgrade path for cinder on the
openstack-dev mailing list. Instead of making oslo lockutils error
if the user has not added a config variable for lock path in their
service (which they never needed to do before) use tempdir instead.

in order to address the security concerns of file truncation attacks,
open the files for locking in 'a' mode, which will make them non
destructive to the underlying files. Add tests to ensure that we
don't truncate underlying files.

also throw an error message to the user that this isn't a safe
mode to run in. That will hopefully mean they will only use this
for the small window of rolling their cluster forward, then
configure it to something more sane.

Change-Id: Ia96a8926741464cf0d47d2c25c77b9c746c1b334

commit_message:

We want to test every element that has a README.md. This will run the
test utility for each one, and report back if any failed. This is
intended to be a target for tox.ini.

subject: Create tests for example metadata and templates
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-04 21:33:31.000000000', 'files': ['bin/test-example-metadata'], 'message': 'Create tests for example metadata and templates

It can be difficult to test these things in their natural environment as
typically one must build an image and deploy it. test-example-metadata
encourages making the example metadata in README.md parsable. We also
attempt to merge it with any os-apply-config templates in the element.

Change-Id: I8c92e8a4808d8c76014fa74279d8a3bbffc017c7
'}]
commit_message:
Create tests for example metadata and templates

It can be difficult to test these things in their natural environment as
typically one must build an image and deploy it. test-example-metadata
encourages making the example metadata in README.md parsable. We also
attempt to merge it with any os-apply-config templates in the element.

Change-Id: I8c92e8a4808d8c76014fa74279d8a3bbffc017c7

This patch ensures the posted size is compared with downloaded imag
size when using --copy-from and kills the image if size differs
(behaving consistently with uploads from posted data).

Also fixes a few tests succeeding because of previous incorrect
behaviour which was assuming image size being the value posted and not
the value calculated from image data.

Change-Id: I08cef2143a5963c3f3c3412208cf3376299f2231
Close-Bug: 1256593
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure posted size is compared with remote size and kills if different

This patch ensures the posted size is compared with downloaded imag
size when using --copy-from and kills the image if size differs
(behaving consistently with uploads from posted data).

Also fixes a few tests succeeding because of previous incorrect
behaviour which was assuming image size being the value posted and not
the value calculated from image data.

Change-Id: I08cef2143a5963c3f3c3412208cf3376299f2231
Close-Bug: 1256593

commit_message:
Replaces assertEqual with assertTrue and assertFalse

In order to improve coding practices and be aligned to a standard,
self.assertEqual(...,True) statements where replaced with
self.assertTrue and self.assertFalse.

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-11-08 07:26:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/test_nova_manage.py', 'nova/cmd/manage.py'], 'message': "Allow nova-manage to set disabled reason

Via nova-manage, one can disable a service.  However, there's not a way
to set the disabled reason.  Add that!

Also, when doing a 'service list', if the service is disabled and
there's a reason, print it.

DocImpact

For docs:

One may now do:

nova-manage service disable host binary <reason>
or:
nova-manage service disable --reason <reason> host binary

For backwards compatibility, the reason is optional.

nova-manage service list adds a 'Disabled_Reason' column at the end.
It'll only print something if the service is disabled and there's a
reason present in the DB.

Change-Id: I362987730f557c09006f71618b29ac8c0d72ded1
"}]
commit_message:
Allow nova-manage to set disabled reason

Via nova-manage, one can disable a service.  However, there's not a way
to set the disabled reason.  Add that!

Also, when doing a 'service list', if the service is disabled and
there's a reason, print it.

DocImpact

For docs:

One may now do:

nova-manage service disable host binary <reason>
or:
nova-manage service disable --reason <reason> host binary

For backwards compatibility, the reason is optional.

nova-manage service list adds a 'Disabled_Reason' column at the end.
It'll only print something if the service is disabled and there's a
reason present in the DB.

Change-Id: I362987730f557c09006f71618b29ac8c0d72ded1

commit_message:
Make the trusted_filter's cache to be global variable

The cache in trusted_filter does not work because a new instance of
TrustedFilter is made each time, which creates it's own cache.
This means that each time a new instance is scheduled, the TrustedFilter
will query the attestation service for all hosts - which is a very slow
operation.

Closes-Bug: 1223450
Change-Id: I58feb727e5d3ac59e04ce07b3326d30e08ff2696

commit_message:
Implements Cross Service Unified Request id

The correlation_id that is generated by the oslo-incubator
middleware is added to the RequestContext and is logged along
with the request_id, to enable more effective debugging
of requests that span multiple services.

Change-Id: I26e288ac3425b609863d40c0c9da51ae3f04effb
Implements: blueprint cross-service-request-id

subject: Support typed schemas for template-from-resource
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-05 20:34:33.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_properties.py', 'heat/engine/properties.py', 'heat/tests/test_resource.py'], 'message': 'Support typed schemas for template-from-resource

This fixes an issue where it was assumed that the schema
was in the legacy dict format.

This change now only attempts to may the Type from property schema
to parameter. Other values like constraints are not now converted.

This could be added back in the future, possibly at the same time
as this is converted to generating a HOT template.

Tests which allow Map->Map->Schema schemas have been changed to
be Map->Schema, since there are zero resources that implement
Map->Map->Schema schemas (there are many resources which implement
List->Map->Schema, and this continues to work).

Change-Id: I839848b1852bb446d87674fc6754cc3c2716cb93
Closes-Bug: #1256191
'}]
commit_message:
Support typed schemas for template-from-resource

This fixes an issue where it was assumed that the schema
was in the legacy dict format.

This change now only attempts to may the Type from property schema
to parameter. Other values like constraints are not now converted.

This could be added back in the future, possibly at the same time
as this is converted to generating a HOT template.

Tests which allow Map->Map->Schema schemas have been changed to
be Map->Schema, since there are zero resources that implement
Map->Map->Schema schemas (there are many resources which implement
List->Map->Schema, and this continues to work).

Change-Id: I839848b1852bb446d87674fc6754cc3c2716cb93
Closes-Bug: #1256191

  scheduler.manager were updated to use taskFlow 0.1.1

Partially implements: blueprint create-volume-flow
Change-Id: Idbac8d001436f02978b366fbb3205ce84c847267

commit_message:

- TaskFlow 0.1.1 was added to Cinder requirements.

- Create volume flows for volume.api, volume.manager and
  scheduler.manager were updated to use taskFlow 0.1.1

Partially implements: blueprint create-volume-flow
Change-Id: Idbac8d001436f02978b366fbb3205ce84c847267
